peMR40h-1fOXy-eKbR1bWA.text: Great little pub. Has an authentic atmosphere and a friendly wait staff. The food was actually quite good. I had the shepherd's pie and the wife had the chicken pot pie. I would recommend either one. I would recommend it.

cF98oC9QxhnSRAPVGm66Rg.text: Ive only ever been here for drinks, but its always been a good time.  Great selection of beer and libations.  And im still waiting to see the Seamus ghost....

8QrnCZI8iYh7RKqbE9sTTA.text: This is a fun place to have a drink almost any night.  There is a very friendly vibe here.  It's not the kind of place you want to go if you are feeling antisocial.  And it's not the kind of place to go if you want to get rowdy.  I strongly disagree with the other review that said it's a rowdy crowd.  It's very friendly, open, and outgoing.  But "rowdy" would make it sound aggressive or violent, and I've never felt that vibe here.  If you sit outside or at the bar, you're going to end up chatting with people sitting next to you.  The staff is friendly, and usually pretty quick.  And the bartenders are always helpful, and willing to let you order things that other places might give you a hard time about (black and tan that's heavy on the black, or a mixed drink with any special instruction).  The bouncer is the coolest guy, but will not put up with anyone giving the staff or other customers a hard time.  If it weren't for him, I could see this place being rowdy.  He sort of sets the feel for the place, and does a great job.  It's not like he's never had to throw someone out, but he does and will the instant someone seems disruptive.  The live bands are usually good.  And when there isn't a band, the jukebox has a very wide range of music.  If you don't like what's playing, give it 5 minutes and you probably will like the next song.  And I've never had anything to eat here that I didn't think was great.  The thing I can think of that might be negative is parking.  But that's True of most places downtown Phoenix, so it doesn't really count against them.

szyG7_TYCmckNVn8ONxv6A.text: I like this place.   I came here for a few drinks as part of a Light Rail pub crawl/birthday night out and a good time was had by all! I was a little surprised that this place was legitimately an Irish dive bar (not that I'm an expert on Irish dive bars). For some reason I had this idea in my head that this was gonna be one of these places that calls itself "Irish" and a "dive," but is actually kind of "cheesy." I don't know why I thought this (location maybe?), but I just did.   Anywho, there's not much to say about the place. There's live music, which I like. There's a small patio for smokers, which is nice for them. The bartenders & drink prices are decent enough. Me and another friend did try and order food, but it was after midnight and the kitchen was closed. I won't knock them for this, since most bar/restaurants close there kitchens early.   When I'm back in Phoenix I wouldn't hesitate to come here again.

cQOVRtNcavi7MjoklfEivg.text: The worse "Steak &Guinness Stout Boxty" -SUPER SALTY! The service, not attentive and outright dismissive.  Absolutely not a place to come back if you are trying to get a decent meal.   AVOID IT IF YOU CAN!

iMYMP_nIiIucXlaks13i5g.text: Fu$ing yes, downtown Phoenix is pretty lame other then for a convention and the standard chotsky sports bats bay the convention center wear thin quickly but I saw this place on yelp and gave it a shot and walked into the Sublime version of Scarlett Begonias playing, saw on of my favorite obscure brands of scotch on the wall and noticed the rueban dip app on the menu and it was awesome and got good clean and quick old school bar service,  this place is winning

The bartender brought him two shots and he drank it. It was a good whisky- BUT the bartender didn't tell him it was $160 A SHOT!!!! The bill was $330 DOLLARS! Isn't it the decent thing to tell the customer the price of an item, especially when it it highly out of the ordinary? Well, customers service is not their thing! Very disappointed.

82vqC8UpugQJyl8aVO36Hw.text: This is one of those places that I have driven by more times than I can count and always go "I want to try that place" but never do because it's not near where I'm going. And maybe that's the only thing that I could consider a bit of a negative, their location is just not the best for us locals. But that seems to be changing as the surrounding neighborhood is beginning to draw more and more reasons to go there.  For me, it was the opening of the new Hilton Garden hotel across the street. Frankly I wish it wasn't called a Hilton so I wouldn't have to explain in the next breath that we chose to stay there because it's NOT like any other Garden Inn ... it's a restored Art Deco building turned INTO a Hilton.  And staying there I can't imagine a better place to wander off to than Seamus McCaffrey's Irish Pub!  This was New Year's eve, and the pub was one of the few places anywhere that wasn't packed to overflowing with revelers. They had a modest $5 cover charge in place because there was live entertainment (compare that to $50-$100 covers some bars try to sock to you on New Years).  We didn't plan to stay (and didn't) but just to have dinner. So we got there about an hour before the band started to play.  I have never had Irish Boxty and as soon as I saw it on the menu it sounded great on a cold winter's night. Mine was the Steak & Guinness and my dining companion had the Corned Beef & Cabbage. Both were humungous portions for only about ten bucks (see photos).  Beer, at $5 each was cheap as well, especially considering what they could have gotten away with on this party night.  Okay, I admit, even before having a beer I was in love with this place. The first and foremost thing it has going for it is that it's not a chain!!!!!  Woohoo.  I pretty much detest chain (or theme) restaurants, and at first glance I could tell this was not one.  It reminded me of my favorite drinking hole (also an Irish bar) when I was just starting out in Chicago, and also reminded me of a favorite (Irish pub) in San Diego. Notice a theme here?  Irish bars don't have to be pretentious, so why make them?  Which brings me to the food.  I'm not going to rave about it or use a lot of fancy words or call Guy Fieri and tell him to get his butt over here to try this dive.  This is not Cordon Bleu, folks, this is pub grub so don't get snooty about it. No it wasn't the best meal I've ever had, but it was hot, filling and tasted awesome. And there was a LOT of it on the plate for the price!  The band started, the partiers started partying and, guess what, it started sounding like an Irish pub. Lots of great craic. Lots of people bumping in to each other. Lots of people singing to the music.  It is very hard to find places like this in Phoenix, Arizona and I'm glad I finally did. I love this place.

They also had a duo on the guitar and drums playing some live music and they were great.  It's festive and lively in here so it might be hard to hear when they're playing but it's a cool place to grab a drink and hang out.

rgifOJX9dHSXBLwi1j8qEA.text: Stumbled upon this little pub on New Year's Eve after everything else was either closed or had a special menu. Seamus' was a great way to spend NYE. They had a live band. xMLzi_BmevMjll3hfBxWUw.text: This place is an icon in downtown Phoenix. When you go, you GOTTA try the Homemade Apple Pie moonshine. That stuff is awesome. This has become my favorite bar in Phoenix.

rfk2dTZM40j-wL0AjiEOgQ.text: So this place it pretty cool. Hands down the cheapest beer of the downtown bars. Usually my first and last spot when I spend a Friday or Saturday night drinking and bar hopping in Downtown Phoenix.

7vaKlL_VDUTU4ixFpTIFug.text: Ok so this is the second maybe third visit to this pub. So service is great staff is awesome. So I have eaten here twice in the last three months. The first time was a bacon burger flavor was good but cooked incosistatly. Partly medium like I wanted but done on other parts. Look I know it's not easy In a kitchen depending on you staff. Having been there myself. So today I ordered the French did which is supposed to be shaved prime rib. Idk about that it's the same meat for the cheese steak. If I made it at home I would have had at least medium done meat. But why should I expect better then from home ? Well that's just it...I should for the for the cost of $13.50. I can get a 1/2 pound burger for $13.00. So after all that had it been 10 bucks I wouldn't be writing this. For that cost there is no reason that I should have more bread then meat and not great bread at that.  Flavor was good but no where near $13.50 worth.  So great place to drink but maybe not value place for food.

iCIc5LgvEjmBPnhbi9YoXA.text: The place seems very out of place in Phoenix, for starters it's about 50 degrees too hot in Phoenix, and it doesn't rainall that much.  The reason it's out of place? It feels real, it's not as pretty as a Ri Ra, meaning it's not touristy.    The Guinness is good, the decor is a hodge podge of Irish and police patches.  It's a great place for an afternoon out of the heat.

dRC3mqdY2S9ArcSE04-kTw.text: I stopped in for a pint of cider on Friday night with some friends. This place is much less of a pub-in-a-box than some other Irish Pubs in the area and has some character to it. It wasn't packed, but was semi-filled with an interesting mix of people trying to get out for an after-work drink downtown.   The wait staff was very attentive and it was a reasonable $5.50 for a pint of Stongbow cider.   Seamus loses a star for having the worst bathrooms EVER! The god-awful stench as you ascend the stairs is enough to make your eyes water and pass out from holding your breath. It smells more like a sewer problem than the bathrooms themselves, but it was enough to make me think twice before bringing out-of-town guests here again.

BKdyCvdiNzHIdFlb16D-Ng.text: I've gone here a couple of times.  It's decent, the food is pretty good.  If you are looking for a place that is chill, this is a great spot.  If you are looking for a more trendy spot in town with amazing food, I'd look elsewhere.

7Xyg91jRZ7WyrKwLJsbqSg.text: I'm going to go out on a limb here and give Seamus McCaffrey four solid stars. Given that I don't really like pubs or pub food, I think that four stars is a pretty high rating.   My rating is based on three major things about the place:   1. The outdoor smoking patio with high tables is really nice if you like to smoke when you drink. It's small but certainly serves its purpose. If you don't like being around smoke, you won't agree with this reason. But you have been forewarned and you can feel free to discount my review.   2. The patrons are a really interesting mix of people. When my husband and I went for happy hour, we saw business men in suits and pony-tailed, t-shirt-clad bikers alike enjoying themselves and relaxing after a hard day at work.   3. Maybe I haven't been too enough pubs to know any better, but I really felt like this place had some heart to it--maybe not soul, but certainly heart. When we went for happy hour, I felt like I was hanging out somewhere that had personality (something I can't say about pretty much every other place I've been downtown). While fun, chic, upscale bars have their appeal, sometimes it's nice to just enjoy a beverage in the comfort of a spot that's a bit more real.   Well, folks, these are my reasons. I fully accept that they may not appeal to you, but if anything I've said strikes a cord and you're looking for a chill place to hang out downtown, check Seamus McCaffrey out.

KB0Th37RY7dghGEr73JGqw.text: My first mistake was letting my friends convince me to go to this place on St. Patty's Day.  Big mistake.  Apparently, they have some big St. Patty's Day party where they block off part of the street in front of the place and charge $10 to get in.  I think that gets you some free grub, which I saw plenty of people eating, but which I was too tepid to try.  Also, they don't accept ANY credit cards that night -- cash only -- so make sure you stop at the bank before you come.

PCg6Ctsihp7dri4R1CNJzw.text: Note: didn't eat here, only drank  My boyfriend talked my ear off about this place for like a month before we came to Phoenix.  I have to say, he talked it up just a liiittle too much.  But it is a special place for him, so I'll forgive.  The place was small and not fancy---just how I like it.  Service was good---meaning I just got off a plane and wanted to get drunk fast and they made it happen.   And great live music!  Carla will return.

fkuzmDrx0qXuTZaDpTpitA.text: Great bar to grab a brew with friends.  The waitress was really pleasant and the beer selection good.  The only thing that really dropped the rating and would prevent me from returning was the frequent pan handlers harassing our group on the patio.  If i go again i'll give up the fun of sitting outside next time and sit inside to avoided to hassle.

rpHKzvCbvBEt4cV5_UP9Jg.text: I can't think of an easier bar to go to. It always has a bizarre-if-nothing-else kind of crowd and the extensive scotch list is great for an adventure. It's also a great place to bike to if you live in the hood. The bartenders remember names in a cheers-esque manner and are quick with your next drink. Also, they leave you the hell alone if you're knee deep in conversation.   Minus a star because of both bathrooms smelling of a variety of bodily functions generally displeasing to the olfactory functions.

lA1nscMerF2SPyiYW0WqDA.text: Going into this place really teleports you to an east coast bar/pub  Unfortunetly the local customers are not what you expect to see in an east coast bar/pub  No obvious cops shooting the shit after a shift, frankly not a lot of people at all. Of the two bars that shared the McCaffrey name. this bar is by far the lesser of the two. From what I've heard Seamus doesn't even own this place anymore. Maybe that is part of the problem...  Police patches adorn the bar..so I'm surprised to not see any police.  There used to be a large collections of lepperchans, I didn't see them last time I went (pub crawl) but I did see a friend from another bar...that was cool. Other then that..i will continue to stay clear of Seamus McCaffery's.  Sorry Bud.  may ye luck be at anothee Baah

kon3jpNdWm_WhREmjjkCig.text: Great place with good people. Good food and the kitchen is open late. Drinks are strong and not overly expensive. With all the places that close early in the downtown area, Seamus is always open till 2am!

tUbrTrm1BB-qB8zph5I8pA.text: Awesome wings!  They're big and meaty, cooked to our specifications of crispy and with a really good spicy/vinegary sauce.  Actually I don't think I've ever had a bad meal at Seamus's.  It's not fancy, it's just a bar with a sampling of American and Irish food.  Service is always good.  They have a variety of booze and beer from Ireland, as well as crap beer for lame people who would dare step foot in an Irish pub and order something that isn't a Guiness/Harp/Smithwick's.  And I've had many good times at this place over the years.

4Ha4COgGWui7R2ugIT3daw.text: I don't drink... but Seamus' is an alright place in my book.  We dropped in after a DBack's game the other night, and I was seriously about to chew off my own arm I was so hungry (and nothing else was open within walking distance... at 10pm... after a baseball game...in the 5th largest city in the nation. Seriously people.).    Seamus' came through for me though - even though the kitchen was about to close and they were only serving apps... I was able to find something veg to eat - Potato Skins, sans bacon.  The service was acceptable overall, but the waitress went out of her way to make sure that I was happy.  When the skins came out with bacon, she had the kitchen remake them right away.  I had to knock off one of the stars because Seamus' is a little bit dirty.  Old bar dirty, not anything to be completely grossed out over... but still.  Go here.  If you drink, have a pint.  Try some food (if you get there early enough).

N24N-5kP6IibJhWntj9T9w.text: I've just got to say .... Service (or lack thereof) can have such a huge effect on an experience and the way you forever remember that place.   Last night I was at the opening night of DR. JEKYLL AND MR. HYDE. After spending about 30 minutes at the cast party, my friends and co-workers decided to wander elsewhere for another drink (or two). A few suggestions were tossed out, ranging from sports bars to hotel bars, but I recommended Seamus McCaffrey's and held to my suggestion strongly. So off we went.   The times I have been there before were fine. Great. Lovely. No complaints.  Then last night we had the most grouchy waitress I have ever met in my life, both in person and created by a writer on TV or in a movie. Seriously. She was so completely unaccomodating and rude, that I don't think I will ever think of Seamus McCaffrey's the same way.   Isn't it odd how one experience can affect them all?   It really is a fun place to go for a drink, so please do try it out. And, there was great live music last night that I enjoyed immensely.

wyyty1AAG_AilnTcJU6ecw.text: My real complaint with this place is the set up.  Its organized far too much like a restaurant and not enough like a pub, which sucks when all you want to do is cozy up to the bar and all the stools are taken.  The beer selection is fine, pretty typical, though i haven't dabbled in their scotches.  Just not the type of place I'd want to drink fine scotch, anyway.  Their smoking patio is cool if you get a sizable group together and you can complain about how dead downtown is and be irritated by the construction of Monroe 44.    I think once their highrise neighbor is established this bar will get much more lively and won't have that dreaded "am I the only person drinking in downtown" feeling that i always get there.    As mentioned on this page, its a good spot to grab and drink and go but not really a place to blow it out all night.

zrNSXB8oMDsPxUsowJMvhA.text: I was craving an Irish Car-bomb on my birthday and this place did not disappoint. The old, drunk patron sitting at the bar did. He had THE worst BO I have ever experienced. We walked in and ordered at the bar. I thought Nico and I would just down the Car-bombs there at the bar, but could barely breathe because of this clown so we went out to the patio. I mean, how could he not know what he smells like? I've also been to Rosie's and even given our short stay at Seamus's, I'd prefer to return to Rosie's.

nHimofUQlOPC27uX7ltv5Q.text: Picked up boyfriend from the airport, so wanted to take him downtown to go to some local pubs. Pretty cool place with lots of seating and friendly-ish people. It was relatively crowded when we came, which was around 11:30 or midnight on a friday, and it looked like they were still serving food ( they actually had a decent menu). Drinks were on the pricier side,  especially for a cocktail. We got the recommendation from a restaurant owner who said it was better then Rose & Crown, which we were looking for. They had a live band that was playing,that was kinda cool  It wasn't too hard to find, because the place next door had strobe lights and loud electronic thumping music and the pub was next more and much more quiet. Good thing bc the music next door was as cheesy as the douchey guys standing in the patio smoking, so we prob would've left

jgw-9QJbV6pUbS2j82ZGNg.text: Just ate lunch here today and while the food was OK--but tending toward flavorless--I thought the service was rather brusque. Also they charge you $1 for a slice of bread if you want it. I get the charge, but at least toss in 2 slices of bread for a dollar.

-XpsD1VnsN2S6zWvAa0KYA.text: Great little (maybe I should say really little) Irish Pub with great food. If you are a Jameson Irish Whiskey fan like me, this is the place. They serve 18 year old Jameson and it is amazing. The fish and chips are really good, too. They have a good beer selection, one you would expect from an Irish pub. There are live bands that play traditional Irish music, a cozy dining room and patio tables and chairs right outside if you prefer to smoke and drink. The service has always been good and the staff is pretty friendly. Parking is a little tough sometimes since it is right downtown. Seamus' is always a great time, friendly crowds and great drinks.

I8kX9bITBOBnHr_bZh6wOQ.text: This place has Powers...and they aren't magical. They have actual Powers which is rare to see now-a-days . This is probably because Powers makes magic happen (or the precise opposite,  more likely.) More likely jail time in Louisiana but that is a special story...  They have good Guinness, good outside tables, and a magnificent whiskey selection if you have that kind of money. I am definitely a fan :)

Tb7p-2yZbvyIrbaqSjZsSw.text: I used to love this place when I lived down the street. I don't make it back too often these days, but I do remember some good times. Their food is consistent Irish Pub fare. It's most fun when they have a live band playing which brings out more of a bar crowd.

BJ2f7Tdy3ZWX0ZzDFc6I1Q.text: Last night a colleague and I went to Twitter's Phoenix Friday Nights at this irish pub downtown. The location was easy to find, and for a Friday night it was a well balanced pub without too many people (as you can sometimes see in downtown bars on the weekends) but enough that it didn't look empty. It wasn't too loud but still had good activity, which made it great for a group meeting.  The full bar looked impressive and a bit authentic as you'd see in Ireland. The bars on the menu were well balanced with different types that I enjoy. I order a few half and halfs Guinness/Strongbow which were really good. After awhile the food people were eating around me looked really good, so I ordered the Shepherd's Pie. I enjoy this meal at many places, so I figured I'd try it here. The waitress was very amenable and highly recommended this meal.  When it arrived, the layer of potatoes was very thing and the cheese was sprinkled across the top instead of layered nicely. The meal was too hot so I had to wait quite a bit to begin eat it. When I forked into it, it was definitely tasty but thing and there wasn't a ton to it. Don't get me wrong, I liked it, but I just expected more.  The wait staff was great, and since we had about a dozen people and they had to weave between us, they were great. We loved the staff. Nice people, good beer, ok food..

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F4uAR1Up7nTmWdM4w7ls6g.text: As a rule, I hate (HATE) Irish pubs. I think the whole concept is tacky and treads on ethnic stereotypes that make me uncomfortable. We live next door to Seamus McCaffrey's and when we moved in, it was a good news / bad news situation: you live next door to a bar but it's an Irish pub. Oh well. We tried it, of course and have now stopped in at least once a week for a pint or two after work.  I can't speak to the food, but the bar is great for drinking. Plenty of seating at the long bar and a really nice selection of beers on tap (and reasonably priced too, especially if you go to the 3-6 happy hour). The really surprising part of this bar is the amazing selection of whisky. I have never seen a better variety of Scotch, Irish, and Bourbon. The other thing that is exciting about this great selection is that the prices seem to reflect availability and not necessarily cost (for instance, some of the one-off, independently bottled scotchs are pretty expensive, but Lagavulin 16 year is around $8 a glass!). Overall, a great neighborhood bar and worth stopping in if you want to grab a pint in downtown.

bW5ILDJw9IE7g85fOKx3EA.text: I get to come here often because it's my husband's favorite bar here in AZ. I guess it's the Irish in him!   Don't get me wrong. I like Seamus'. Never had a bad time here by any means. It's a dive in downtown. Has that older (though a bit musty feel). I love all the trinkets at the bar and pictures on the wall. Obviously Seamus could use some new tables, bathrooms and carpet, but I don't expect this place to snazz up and become something it isn't. I find sitting at the bar to be the most fun area here.   Beers on tap are cold, they pour a Guinness right, have wine, and have large pours on hard liquor. Small patio out front can certainly be fun for some people watching! Sometimes they have live music, which certainly peps the place up. There is always an upbeat feel here. A vibe of people having fun. Varied crowd and I have always felt safe and comfortable. Be careful if you use the restrooms upstairs. The stairs are rickety, steep and I tend to feel like the toilet is going to fall through the floor. It hasn't yet! (knock on the wood the bar is made of).   Diverse menu with decent food. Always friendly service. Certainly not a place I would ever turn down going to. Just not my #1 pick for a night out. More like my #10. :)   Cheers!

lPuRpnFv6lCzNN73QEMCvQ.text: Seamus McCaffrey's is always a good bet for good food and drink.  From the food menu, you need to stick with the Irish traditional dishes for the best food.  The boxtys, corn beef and cabbage and shepherd's pie are some of my favorites...with a Guinness, of course.

-fpDCR3Ppji9V4XB_PCQGg.text: This place is a hole in the wall, and in this case that's not a positive. The food was nothing I'd go out of my way to have again if I'm ever in town again. To top it all off, the sole server the night of my was very rude. She complained a lot about having to deal with a large group (despite the fact that it also probably meant a large tip), as well as a number of other things. I'm sorry we ruined her night by bringing in a bunch of business on what was an otherwise slow night. Food was nothing special.

u5MTYpspU9TkIW4SCYxVZw.text: I have been going to Seamus for YEARS.  Loved it for the entire time that there was nothing else to do downtown, loved it just the same after lots of stuff opened downtown.  But I believe I've seen the beginning of the end of the world.  I ordered an Irish Coffee.  I got coffee with Bailey's Irish Cream.  I ask the server, she says that IS an Irish coffee, and that the bartender thinks so too. I say, no, an Irish Coffee is Irish whiskey in coffee with a little cream floated on top (and back in the day at Seamus, a little creme de menthe drizzled on).  She says she's never heard of such a thing but they could make me one "if I wanted it that way."    (May I also say that, prior to the Irish coffee incident, she told me that my Black and Tan was actually called a "Half and Half" at Seamus's.  Really? REALLY??)  Call this petty if you want to, but this is serious stuff...

NgUFN4WAxTP-ERNwAODyBw.text: This Irish Pub is one of the best in the Phoenix, AZ area.  The bar staff is friendly and the atmosphere is really good.  Along the bar they have patches from different law enforcement agencies.  Because of the downtown location, there are often meetings and conferences for law enforcement agencies.  They donate a patch to this bar.  I have seen patches from all over the country, including federal agencies.      The food is typical bar fare, with an Irish theme (go figure).  Some of the food is delicious, like the burger.  However, the Cobb salad leaves in a little to be to be desired.   Overall this is one of my favorite pubs in the Phoenix area.  I would recommend it to anyone.

-zgK5JA_IHpgyMkQWEiNJw.text: Went here for lunch, was super excited about getting into some Irish cuisine, but left with my hopes and dreams shattered.  I started off the evening with a delicious and refreshing tall glass of the one and only Guiness beer, off the tap of course.  It was amazing as usual.  5 stars.  Next I ordered a shepard's pie, which I'd actually been craving for quite some time.  When it came to me I knew there was going to be some problems.  It was tiny, and looked like something I could whip up in my kitchen in no more than 5 min.  And I guess that's all they did in the back of the bar, with little to no effort, it tasted as much.  Minus one star.  I was still hungry, so I decided to order another meal figuring it was still early and I could just eat the leftovers for dinner.  I elected the corned beef and cabbage.  5 min later I received an impostor.  This was no corned beef I've ever seen.  It was instead a shaved meat that tasted kinda like it, with obviously CANNED potatoes, surrounded with an abundance of cabbage and now I'm upset.  Minus two stars.  This is a PUB, NOT A RESTAURANT.  Guiness was great, food sucked big time.

LTl2v0fn4pOx_zEB-uMctg.text: Cool irish pub.  Sat outside under the misters and had a pint of Kilt Lifter.  Pretty tasty.  Nice place to have a pint and watch the world go by.  Servers were friendly.  Watched a dog get more action from the ladies than most guys would get.  Will go back again.

KnuAfqXqqMXNnskdLwtVnA.text: Beth is the bomb-ass blonde whose Harlem-shake brings all the boys to the McCaffrey's yard. She serves booze, food and Weapons Grade sass. She also juggles chainsaws with her feet while doing prolonged handstands in a mini skirt. Dinner and a show?? What a deal!!!

lolwIqj0cE_UTOIgZCyN5A.text: Classic Irish bar in DTN Phx. I love Seamus because it just feels good walking in the doors. I've been her a few times and have enjoyed each experience. Good times!  On our last firm her I had the cajun chicken sandwich and my buddy had the classic corn beef. Both good but I have to admit that the I was jealous I didn't choose the corn beef. I'll be sure to have this on my next trip to Seamus!!!!

EGnMYm3jSSVPJcXOYYm6YA.text: Low key establishment.  Its consistent so you usually know what you're in for.  Bar tenders are pretty cool - its the same hard working and nice young guys every time I go there (weekends).

iVVgvMCn7lsLhtgkWUOmNA.text: Seamus is there for every occassion in your life.  Maybe it's St. Patrick's Day and you are hankering for some corned beef and a guinness - GO!  Maybe you're watching a show at Orpheum - GO!  Maybe you go for a run every Thursday with your friends and are super sweaty and thirsty - GO! (and join our run club, don't be a fool and run alone).  Seamus McCaffrey's is an old, long and narrow bar (just like the Philadelphia bars I've come to love so much) that has strangely cozy dorm-room furniture.  Be warned: it is definitely a local bar.  If you went to high school here, expect to see a fellow grad.

cloMHjDWHKsup5wBS_PRtw.text: Relaxed atmosphere. I ordered the fish and chips; my buddy ordered the steak and mushroom pie. Neither disappointed. Service was great. Our waitress was attentive and courteous.   I will most assuredly return to this fine pub!

OEVwMIs5lqTBV0zV-FmLPA.text: 2nd stop off the rail pup crawl.. a little walk, nice place for regulars but they did not seem to like having a large excited group there. The server was good, the drinks were good and the price was good.   The restroom stunk like old piss.

5vsRhGZrnWZ7pYTxvQz8Mw.text: Seamus is fun. When I lived in Phoenix I went there all the time.

btYeHGGQhaL8J82U3-4jTg.text: This is a neat little place that looked pretty full on a Friday night because most of the patrons were jammed up top the bar area. Otherwise, it was only about 1/4 full. I was wondering why there wasn't a couple of guitar players or something on the small stage but then I realized I would have not been able to hear people talk. Friendly, unpretentious patrons all around us!   I think if I lived downtown, I would come to this place regularly. My guess is that it has a pretty good happy hour crown during the week.

lPacU8iJIiWmAfNES2x1vw.text: Good Ol' Irish Pub! With a large variety of selection, this is the one place I enjoy a Kilt Lifter. Atmosphere is cool and staff is great. Can't beat their happy hour menu!

38Ys_BMUR9nxeyWr4R39RQ.text: We stopped here for dinner before catching the performance of HAIR at the Herberger Theater with Amanda B. and her sister. This pub / restaurant has a quaint laid back atmosphere and quite a few brews on tap Guinness, Bass , etc; I chose a pint of Smithwick's to accompany my dinner.   The menu has traditional Irish fair like Corned Beef, Sheppard's Pie, as well as burgers, salads and sandwiches. I went the safe route and had a Swiss Cheese Mushroom burger which went well with the pint I ordered. I liked the fact that the burger was 1/3 pound and had a decent flavor.   Seamus' has a great downtown location, half a block off the light rail. The majority of the menu is priced under $10 and quite an array of offerings so everyone should find something they like.

4J2WIzICTdqcuHEDkx58hg.text: What can I say? I love this place. Early afternoon or after midnight, Seamus' is the shiznit. Food is always delicious. Bar does it right. No complaints here. With all the new up and coming spots in the downtown area, Seamus' is my old reliable... on Friday and wknds, they have live music. Last Friday night, 2 dudes managed Rage Against the Machine and System of a Down like nobody's business. Suddenly everyone who knew a thing or two about a good thing as it was happening was watching them. One of the reasons I really dig this no-frills joint. Good times.

LazKG4xJQvEqLvmpK-rsKg.text: This is a good dive bar if you're looking for cheap food and drinks late at night, but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner or authentic Irish fare. We were pretty underwhelmed with the food and the service.

y5NFdBSrVosQ08z9fNnRIw.text: Service for takeout is horrible. I live next door at the apartments and have tried it out like 3 times and just bad.  Same bartender watches you come in and wait for food, just ignores every time. I have had to walk to the back area each time to check on food.  Not only is customer Service bad, the chef salad is terrible. Lettuce welted.  I've learned my lesson, not going there anymore.

p1XcgUSFk3JHbNuz_dC5yQ.text: Very cute little establishment!  I had the shepard's pie and it was wonderful!  The waitress was very attentive and super friendly!  I have been patronizing this place for a while now,  and finally felt inclined to compliment this place as they are consistent with their quality of food and their customer service!

CNnDwkJ4IT7xJTnLssyJ-Q.text: Good bar...food was ok. Bartender was ok...so I can this place was ok. Not really impressed I might go back but time will tell. Who does t love a good Orsh bar.

y-AQilVZ-brpuzKkKLV2Fg.text: I came here for a drink and food while the Final Four was going on. Got a Jalapeno burger and it was really awesome! There were a ton of people but we got a seat at the bar. The staff was really friendly.

UnE5nNMD807yeNDY-Mp5Bw.text: I live right next door to this place so i have been here often and there's really nothing bad i can say about it. The staff is awesome, the atmosphere is welcoming and for a bar, their food is just awesome!! On Fridays they usually have a band playing and there hasn't been one that I haven't liked yet. Which is pretty rare. Only gripe about that is that its a fairly small bar and so when the band plays its extremely loud, to the point you can't really talk to your people when they play. On Friday and Saturday nights it gets really busy so I suggest getting there before 10PM or you might have a hard time finding a seat inside. Minor gripes, still deserving of the 5 stars though! Cheers!

EVZzWWgcafzS1B-am3Lh5w.text: Fish and chips are always good. Great service and Irish music. Good place for happy hour with a down home Irish inspiration.

6PZsP3fyDg9Ero9ilnx9dw.text: Generally this is a fun place to go. It's near the light rail and it's right downtown for the office drones to unwind after work. I only gave this 3 stars because it completely let me down tonight when I had food delivered. Normally the food is exactly what you expect from a pub--heavy comfort food that hits the spot if you're out drinking. It also has one of my favorite chef salads. Tonight I had a salad delivered for tomorrow and a beef stew delivered for dinner tonight. I've traveled in Ireland and the Irish excel at comfort soups and stews.   What I got tonight was sincerely bad. It was insanely over salted and heavily congealed. I picked out the three pieces of meat, two carrot slices, and one potato bit and left the remaining salty jelly for my begging dog. Even she didn't get past a couple of licks. Bad, bad. I expect better for both the price and the heritage of the dish.   There is a rivalry between Seamus' and George and Dragon. GND got its little feelers in a bunch over my review and asked for it to be taken down. I will say one thing...at least GND accurately reflects the horrible, bland, heavy food of the English...quite a low bar. The Irish have much better food and a correspondingly higher bar. Damnit, Seamus', I root for you in this!  You can do better...please do.

mmfbXaR7anhbPYjAcEn9_Q.text: and went in here to get something to go because I was going to a gathering very near this place. The very friendly waitress she did myself and my friend and we ordered of beer and food. I ordered shepherd's pie because the menu clearly stated that it was meat vegetables and potatoes. I decided to eat there because the food arrived two sips into the beer. What I experienced was mashed potatoes with enough gravy for flavor no meat in about 4 sweet peas. So basically I paid $13 for mashed potatoes. I will never eat there again, never.Typical loud bar scene. Very disappointed!!

Lxlip8kBmAVdaoL-JVbc8A.text: Extremely quick service, not too expensive, and very good food. We stopped there after a show for a quick bite and stumbled upon a live band finishing up their set. They were excellent! I ordered the steak and mushroom pie and it was delicious. Highly recommend this place.

OgOK7mpEGHoxYBcfOnv12w.text: Made it here late night and grabbed a table for our wild group! Service was quick and drinks were Cold! What more can you ask for???

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Late night grub

q_DwzuWMINIvMEdsatAHlg.text: This place is  amazing!! Randal makes a mean drink:) Very social and inviting place; you feel right at home!! And great bar stools!!

KrBiADsl8OIVObPk_VNPHw.text: What a great experience! Live band on Friday night! Very homey feel for being downtown phx. Ken was especially great! Super friendly and knowledgeable about the drink selection.

35pGJxROlaS3v5jc2bPvEw.text: Great Irish bar in PHX. Open late (2am).  Friendly bartenders, Irish/local beers, and live music. Can't go wrong with that.   Serve food until midnight, drinks till last call (prior to 2am)

keHmDWvDAI1wFZhrbzNsrQ.text: We had the fish and chips and the corn beef and cabbage, which was the best corn beef and cabbage I have ever had in a restaurant! Nicely done. Thank you.

3x_zXQB3bbXZZ4FiwnseDQ.text: I've been here a few times and it's really a pretty good place on the surface. It has a nice Irish feel, a well stocked, pretty looking bar, and the staff has been friendly. However, there are some things that make this place, just ok.  I've been here 3 times and it seemed like the same band was there each time. They weren't playing anything Irish and the singer wasn't very good. I could live with that, if the sound wasn't turned up so loud that I couldn't have a conversation.  Some nights were better than others. If you're with a group and wanna do Irish Car bombs and not have any conversation, come down on the weekend. If you wanna talk and have a couple drinks in a nice Irish place, maybe come on a weekday.   The food is basically just bar food. They do have a decent selection of whiskeys and scotch, however the beer leaves a bit to be desired in the variety department.   All in all, I stop in here once in a while when i'm downtown, but I don't really go out of my way to track it down, especially with healthy amount of bars downtown has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pu9JTUUF6pGEwq2nEMBjdA.text: Took my son here for his birthday lunch.  The fish and chips are good. The prices are good and the service is decent.  It's nothing fancy but the food is good.

Rvx_xL3leCm7vra2kF8o8Q.text: My friend and I tried the French dio and Philly cheese steak and we not impressed.  The sauteed onions looked steamed, no bowling whatsoever. The rolls were a bit hard after only a few seconds which lead us to believe there was some microwaving going on, likely to melt the cheese as the meats were warm but not hot. Pretty disappointing. Regardless, if you're looking for authentic Irish food, I'd give it a try as we didn't try those food options. The Guinness was about $7 a pint as well.

51hGwGfjkWwkT3E9neDxVg.text: I have to say that each trip that I make from California to Phoenix is a new discovery. We stayed at the hotel San Carlos next door to this lovely Pub. For three nights in a row we had the pleasure of the Fantastic service to be had at this establishment. The first night when we only ordered coffee they insisted that we could not come into an Irish Pub without having a drink and gave us a shot on the house. Very friendly and Pleasant staff took care of us the subsequent three days. There is a mixed crowd of people. They have tables indoors and out. There's just something about this place that is warm and inviting and makes you want to stay and just talk long into the night. They play nice music and it's very inviting.

RDPk6SeshaCAfLDAOZJqQw.text: Enjoyable downtown pub. I almost always stop here when I'm downtown late at night. It's an institution, for sure.

l-3nqiASy9XvkZpVUEGNfA.text: I can never quite decide how I feel about Seamus'.  On the one hand, the bar is well stocked with Irish beers on tap and all the associated "Look we're Irish!" crap, just like Rosie McCaffrey's.  From first impressions, I thought it was an iffy place trying a little too hard, but I must confess that I've spent some great nights holed up with a load of friends drinking in one of the corner booths.  Prices are pretty standard, around $5 for an import pint.  The food is good and they tend to keep the kitchen open fairly late (10:30 or so).    Still, the overall impression is of a place that's uncomfortably straddling the line between bar and restaurant.  Not quite homey enough to feel like a real Irish pub and without the eccentricities of the Bikini Lounge or even Bar Bianco.  Not really close to Casey Moore's or Rula Bula in terms of Irishness.

M1r8MLg6mvd--6eJIpCO9w.text: It is what it is.  A real Irish bar, reasonably priced beer and wind.  Good bar food and good talk.  I am comfortable here talking to the locals and the tourists.  If you are a bar afficionado, this is the place in Phoenix for good talk and a few drinks.

zrx6J0i9cgRuiFNNeRPzaQ.text: Stopped in, had a couple of drinks, paid and left. Nothing to get excited over, but a decent stop if you like Irish whiskey and need a fix.

j0HxiT1WnFF22DVc5-rvJQ.text: The atmosphere is faux irish pub. The beers are slightly overpriced. All this could be forgiven if not for the terrible service. The waitresses were rude. Apparently serving customers was not part of their job description. Requests for service were repeatedly ignored and this cannot be blamed on a full crowd because the bar was half full at best.  Choose another spot for a truly friendly irish pub where the beers are cheap and everyone has to sing a song :)

kCGxajBNn7DZpwYKlhSduA.text: It's True, their wings are really good.  Also they have tons whiskey bottles to look at and I guess you could probably drink some of it too if you just ask.

RAgv-LtcVcC46MXb1VuscQ.text: # of males with asscrack visibly showing: 4+ # of females present with an asscrack i'd want to see: 0 # of gnarly raspy voiced ladies with shitloads of tats: 3+  i had no idea that an irish bar in downtown (insert city) could compete with the dives i've been to for stankhole status... minus the eye candy.  the two stars are for the staff.   stay classy phoenix

mIHu3RjOiwTziNPGpemDpA.text: Friendly staff, plenty of options behind the bar and decent food for the price. I had the "boxty."

3l_ysKwatqXnRUVTj-gwtA.text: I came here with a coworker while in town on business Saturday night after watching the UFC fights and had a good meal.  There was a decent crowd and sat ourselves at a table near the door to people watch a bit.  Typical Irish Pub menu with really great prices.  Our waitress was nice enough but after we told her we needed a couple minutes to look over the menu - she didn't come back for like 15 lol.  We both had a Strongbow cider and the Reuben sandwich.  Both were very tasty.  The sandwich was a good size - I ate about 3/4 of the sandwich and only half my fries before I was full.  I would definitely come back here again and maybe try a Boxty dish :)

oHhLyYXjJYO-e8KknnG2kw.text: This review is based on the place as a drinking establishment. I have not tried their food, but have been here twice on Saturday nights and was not impressed by either experience.  The bar area is a bit tight and very loud. It's nearly impossible to have a conversation. The music is decent, though as someone else mentioned, very little of it is Irish. On my last visit, I realized the drink prices are high and the bartenders, perhaps not trustworthy.  My friend had opened our tab and thorughout the night I had 2 drinks while he had 4 - that's a TOTAL of 6 drinks, all wells. After closing the tab, he came over and told me the total bill - $60!!!!  I marched up to the bar to see how that could be and found they had added 4 more drinks to the tab, as well as charging an extra 1$ per drink because we'd asked for them tall (meaning a little more soda - most places don't charge for this). The bartender did not want to go through the hassle of voiding the CC transaction and instead said he'd refund us cash. The first refund was only for 2 drinks so we went back to ask about the rest. He said "oops" and gave us a refund for the other 2. We gave up and left at that point, but there still was no refund on the added $1 for those for drinks or the total tip which was based on a $60 bill that should have been $36.   I may be venting more than reviewing now, but take heed here and review your bill before paying it!

ijLfK6g8BHF3pzNUemyYcw.text: Probably my favorite Irish pub in AZ for Sunday nights because it's rather casual, with live music, and the service/food isn't bad either.  I can't comment on the busier nights here.  They pour a good pint of Guinness and it has a small, intimate feel that I miss from the Irish pubs I used to frequent in Chicago.

NGrWhPsjwP8kYIDIGk4O7g.text: I was out with friends on a saturday night and we decided to check it out after going to a bunch of snooty bars in the area. I liked the casual atmosphere and the dim lighting. The only problem I had was that they did not know how to make a black and tan, which was disappointing because we were in an irish pub. I was also charged for two drinks that night when I ordered one drink and after much debate I was given a "complimentary" drink, which was not really free since I had already paid for an extra drink. But other than that, this place is good place to hang out if you are looking for a casual bar. Oh, and a friend had the chicken tenders and said they were good.

YTPYeDA5Shl-7qhIavbAQA.text: Wow, after reading mixed reviews i wasnt sure what to expect. We went here for dinner and drinks before a show at the Dodge Theatre. It was packed, but luckily we found a seat. It seemed to be understaffed for such a large crowd, but the waitress was great. The food was even better. My girl got the fish n chips and i had the shepards pie. Very conventional irish fare and a safe bet. For $8 an entree the food was amazing. The beers were cheap, tasty and always full. The atmosphere was a typical Irish pub, being loud and lively.  This place is great and will only get more crowded as soon as the light rail opens. They also have a great whiskey selection and great decorations. FYI this place is perfect before any major event downtown.

ZTnsNrHZL6A6X27yW_Fxyw.text: I'd only been there a couple of times before but they remembered my name and what I liked to drink. Pretty good in my book. I guess it's like a local bar, but downtown. I'll be back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

C5TQpAOPa44PJohKe1Su4A.text: The bar/building/atsmophere/service good. The food, well eeeewwww. I have no eating disorder but I have tried to pruge the Potato cake Steak, Mushroom Guiness sauce meal out of my belly. And not because it was rotten, but because it was that bad. The cake was decent. However, I think they went to Denny's to get the can o' sauce. Seriously the last time time I had food this bad was when my mom dragged me to Denny's 6 years ago. If this food didn't come out of a ten gallon can marked "Irish Food" I would be shocked. It tasted as if they made a pan out of a salt lick, pored in Cambells "something" mix and let it soak up the chemicals and salt for days. Eat at Mcdonalds before you come here, then enjoy the bar.

Zyyp7ZhAaR4tfrmnV9syow.text: With the two restaurants closest to the Dodge Theatre not serving alcohol (you know who you are....bastards!),  finding Seamus McCaffrey's before the Margaret Cho show was like finding an EZ Bake Oven under the tree Christmas morning. Complete joy! I really don't know downtown so when we turned the corner and saw a bunch of smokers shwilling pints on the sidewalk, we ran like school girls chasing Zac Efron. Quickly and with our tongues out. We were thirsty and ready to catch a buzz before the show. Inside it was sort of narrow with a long bar on one side and scads of tables throughout. We spied an open table on the "patio" and were told we could nab that and our server would be right out. And she was. Delightful and speedy. We ordered two Stellas and a couple shots. Didn't see any food, but perused a pretty big menu. Usual fare with approachable prices. Thank you, though, Seamus, cuz the group on the "patio" was much more entertaining than Ms. Cho!

Xx0nZewqGIsJDPyNcORgWA.text: The atmosphere is neat, until you get to meet the regulars, including self-proclaimed "family members of the owner".  It appears they can do what they want.  Give your money to someplace else.

Yx5_BfoCM8aT9-i4h473cA.text: Authentic Irish pub that serves authentic food. Great beers on tap and awesome location downtown.

wOyOSFVR10jl9BoZZYdlzg.text: Hello!  I rarely will write a review about an establishment as I work in the industry and detest yelp. But I was asked to look into a certain review made here by kelvin h.   I have been coming to this bar for over 5 years. I started when I was around 24. I would come into the bar before my POS210 class and get two vodka sodas because the class was unbearable sober.  Let me start with the things I like.   I love that I can walk inside on a Monday morning and Dana will shout, "Hey sugarplum!"   I like that Malydia will let me smoke with her even though I know she is stressed from hearding waitresses and bartenders into position.   I like that I called Mike "Matt" for 3 years and he would just smile and ask me what I'm drinking.   I like that Liz always makes me feel like I'm a little brother that she hasn't seen and honestly listens to my adventures. Truly interested.   I like that I can talk to Brandon about dogs, mustaches, and ponytails, and he never mentions my poor shaving routine.   I love that the security always has my safety in mind and talks to me like I'm just as important as a celebrity looking for a reprieve from all the madness.   I like that Randy will come out from out behind a busy bar to hug me and ask, "hey buddy. How are you?"  I like that Jessa wants me to stay so she can finish her side work and grab a drink with me on the patio.   Most of all I like that when I'm inside Seamus I'm not a "fag", a "sissy" or "unwanted" I'm valued. And kelvin h. That feels pretty good.   Did I mention I'm gay. Oh yeah I forgot, I guess the staff here did too. They know me as Mattie.   Please patron this establishment and show them the same respect they bestow on you.   -Mattie

7iepzH-DUApmqinORdLxMw.text: Really damn good,   they're generous and their menu takes almost every diet into consideration.    Salads are delicious,   pub fare is very good comfort food..    and of course they've got a wide selection of beers to enjoy.   Comfortable establishment, too - with very friendly and thoughtful staff.     I can't quite give them 5 stars but there's really nothing wrong here.

OcJSwQgw2jgUeU618jCEnQ.text: An Irish bar that doesn't have Guinness glasses and bartender doesn't know how to pour. SMH

JNLIkM7hOAg7U8F6zRDdpg.text: Of the many places to get a beer in Phoenix, this was my favorite.  A simple menu of both beer and food make this a comfortable place to be.  The taps are standard local and imported beers, they don't rotate all that much but that makes it easy to know what you want.   The food menu is always good and goes great with the beer.  I never had anything that I didn't enjoy and that wasn't tasty.  If you are in downtown and want a place to eat and drink, come here.  I will be sure that I find a hotel near this location when I visit again.

2qzorlx2LrTi7PLop4Ewhw.text: I came here with coworkers to celebrate one of their birthdays. I must admit I was pleasantly surprised. The drinks were reasonably priced and they were the only establishment open late in downtown Phoenix. I would recommend this place for anyone trying to find a nice bar downtown after hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Lemomade

IfXbgpMcl9kC29bUJh7Wpg.text: Great location in downtown.  This is the epitome of dive bars.  The place is old, musty, and actually smells bad.  It always has this sewer odor covered by lysol smell.  I used to work across the street so it was convenient to come here.  But the smell just got worse and worse.  Too bad.  Their happy hour drink specials were great and servers seem nice.

M_xx7zxzYNK3cDtbLjbH5Q.text: This is a nice local bar. Before I turned vegan, I loved sitting outside eating finger food -- chicken tenders and fries with a nice fresh beverage. Take a load off -- stop by if you have a chance. Oh, the St. Patricks day festivities is also very nice!

-f0XLOb7F0IvRNLrQJzizg.text: Love this place! Great bartenders, staff and great drinks. This place actually has character and the crowd is pretty fun- we made some great bar friends while we were here (the inexpensive drinks and beer concoctions helped in this friendship, no doubt).  It was pretty mellow when we came early in the night before a show we were heading to at the US Airways Center. The bartender was great- even gave us his personalized mini-map of the area with all his bar recommendations. Very cool! We came back after the show and it was rammed, but the staff was still friendly and we had hardly any wait at the bar, event though we were standing 4 people back.  Great place!

sNjnyF47PCtkbOd1SL5Sfg.text: Fun vibe. Drinks were well poured and not overpriced. Decor is fun and atmosphere is upbeat. Good for talking, but hit or miss if you are with a group.

CyRH3Jevfyk8tJLGBRNuqQ.text: I work downtown and this is a convenient spot to hit for lunch or happy hour. But, I've never liked my experiences here and maybe I just have higher standards but I'd rather go to any number of places for lunch or happy hour.   The issues start with the fact that Seamus is dirty, dusty, and has terrible food, warm beer and pretty terrible service. I just had lunch again here Friday and we had to wait over an hour for a couple salads and appetizers. It's honestly the worst.   The place hasn't been upgraded or had any money put into fixing it up in decades- it's just subpar in every way. And every time I see dirt or dust and have to use their rundown bathrooms I can't help but think - if this is how they maintain the areas customers see, what about the place my food is prepared?

A510Xl41B2LKojk_Zw424w.text: After going to Rose and Crowns and Turf last week. I have to say that Seamus McCaffrey's is still far and away my favorite pub in town.  Rosie's and Hanratty's aren't too far behind but if you are downtown, Seamus is the place to get yourself a Guiness.  There is always a sea of quirky customers to befriend and the service is fast.  The bands that play do some killer covers and Irish whiskey keeps the spirits high.    Downsides:  Faint smell of urine and it can sometimes be a sausage-fest.  But who cares?  You go here to get drunk and have a laugh with good company.

h2PdabumBSxCVAq1O9AQGA.text: Good bartenders and a cool local crowd. Much better than hanging out at the hotel bar with a bunch of conventioneers!  One of the best scotch selections I've seen anywhere. Great beer choices and Irish food too. I come every time I'm in town.

HVPdHtW-UBCb5q6oUOTjxA.text: This place is a dive and is frequently loud with yelling Irish music far from the traditional music Irish love. Don't be fooled by the reviews of the great food, it's ok with poorly made drinks and a dirty atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The indecision is gross

0XZuvzfzbMewyHC-NTBADg.text: Awesome bar! One of the first bars I actually went to after turning 21 and now I constantly wanna go back. No matter what kind of mood I'm in I always feel comfortable and relaxed once I'm there.   They play good music and at a decent volume so I don't have to shout at the person sitting next to me. Some nights they have specials like $2 shots and what not.   Love going to Seamus with my friends, sitting in my usual seat, and hanging out for a good hour or five. I like that it's not crowded with a bunch of woo girls but is a much more mellow place.

X8BQa11M_gd2ut-ew6cPpQ.text: Stopped in here before a Diamondbacks game, because we had just learned that the Copper Door (located a few feet away) was no longer in business.  Hey, it really smelled like a bar... but it is a bar, so good job!  The fish and chips were OK.  The Irish stew was OK.  The Blue Moon had a big wedge of orange, and it was great.  They had bottled Bud Light.  And the review from "suneel t." wonderfully described the patrons.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Irish Beef Stew and Irish Soda Bread

0QFQ1EaPrW8WdzdV4LyFsg.text: Super friendly bartender. Cool Irish vibe . Had the fish and chips and they were off the chart. Prices were reasonable . Went on a Saturday around 2 and it was really busy. Drink prices were reasonable .

tVTcpTLwSQspnoMAylgitw.text: Well this bar in a great spot. Past that no thank you. Overlooked fried food and the worst pint of Guinness I have ever had. I think the tap lines were last cleaned when bush was in office. Horrible service and bartender seems to be an old trailer park manager.

yIb00Xw48XqIYw7Bm5rf2Q.text: Walked in at around 8 on a moderately busy Friday night. Sat at the bar. Got ignored by the bartender for seven minutes while he walked by a few times, looked angry, and stacked glasses (to be fair other folks got the same treatment). Left. Go someplace else.

KT7HuCMbXaQQhW_w1uMUkw.text: Stopped in for some drinks with my boyfriend on Sunday afternoon. (I can't believe I haven't reviews this place yet.) If you like your bars dark and dank with interesting signage all over the walls and a healthy selection of Scotch and Whiskey, this is your place.  (I happen to prefer a dark bar so take this as a complement.)  After a few beers we ordered lunch.  I had the veggie burger with fries while my boyfriend ordered the chicken pot pie.  I hadn't been to Seamus' in a while and my veggie burger was better than I remembered.  The fries were exactly as I remembered.  (I love fries and steak fries are among my favorites right behind the super crispy shoestring variety.)   All of this was a great reminder of why Seamus McCaffrey's is one of my "go to" bars.

_T_16FFBtlstUbq88LBy8A.text: We visited on a Monday for lunch around 1 and other than a couple people at the bar the restaurant was empty. We sat ourselves and a server came over almost immediately to take our drink order. We looked over the menu and all of us decided on burgers.  We ordered mozzarella sticks to begin but place or meal order at the same time.  Unfortunately the server came back out to tell us they had run out of mozzarella sticks so we left it at just the burgers.  I ordered the Seamus pub burger with no extras (cheese, avocado and bacon are all extra charges) but I did upgrade to the onion rings instead of steak fries.  The burger as delicious with a great char taste that gave the burger that little something extra in the taste. The vegetables on the burger were crisp and fresh which also attributed to the yummyness. The onion rings were good but not necessarily worth the $2 upcharge. They were also just above room temperature.  Hubby ordered the garlic parmesan burger and said it was delicious. He got cottage cheese as his side and that was up to his liking.  Our daughter ordered the Western burger and she said it was one of the better Western burgers she's had. I smoked the BBQ sauce from the burger and it was slightly spicy with a great smoky taste to it. She got the steak fries which were good but I would have preferred a crispier outside. They were however very hot when they came to the table.  Drinks weren't filled as quickly as I would like but once we asked they were filled quickly.  Parking can be tricky as it is located downtown. We parked in the first spot we found and then walked to the restaurant.  A few missteps (no cheese sticks, lukewarm onion rings, slow refills) but I would give this place another chance only because the burgers were so delicious.

GmXJbuxKM6vsvuIxTese-w.text: Stopped by for a couple drinks with my wife. Live music and great whiskey selection with very fair price  Update: They recently increased the prices of their whiskey list drastically. The list on their website is incorrect. The price is no longer better than the other, much nicer bars in the area. Would no longer recommend.

KI7xmcbLRzScZ-Pwbgkk1A.text: The atmosphere, the drink selection, the food, and the excellent service are all reasons to come here. My friends and I like to stop by here every once in awhile after work for drinks and split some chicken strips and fries. We eat at the bar and I believe the woman that is there during the day (and maybe nights) is named Katie. She is the best. So sweet, hilarious, yet very attentive and professional. All of the staff is great. Love this place so much! A classic here in downtown Phoenix!!!

GYtUeU6qxVASSItxU8rb9w.text: Laid back place with Irish vibe. We tired Chickenboxty and Corned Beef & Cabbage Boxty. Both were good.

IZVYukEVqdW6qWmiZWATng.text: The bouncers are so fucking unprofessional and power hungry. They literally kicked us out because I made a comment to my bf about there carding policy. Apparently there is no freedom of speach and they think they can put their hands on you and cuss at you whenever they feel like it. I ended up having to call the cops on them. I will never go to this place again. So ghetto and unprofessional.

ozo31dcMlnE1uT3Xg3qh_w.text: This food was terrible !! My wings where burnt  and Andrew the gentleman at the bar was rude ..

RY__U2r2eQhjCa77blnoJQ.text: Went there today with my mom cuz I told her they have good fries and patty melts. Leah was our server. She was super cool and chatted us up a bit.. cute too. Lol! Food was just what we needed and we left happy

BHOKtqJub8VwRB_c2eizUA.text: Cozy, friendly, great food, clean and welcoming. Live music & convenient location to downtown venues. Try it before or after the game! Or just sit here and watch the game on TV.  YOU'LL LOVE IT!!

CgKC6Mqi-u5d30WJzgN56w.text: Love this place!! The food is absolutely awesome and so is the staff. The atmosphere is friendly and inviting. I'll definitely be coming here a lot!

T2ko5K5ti6pRQFHFRTGn1A.text: My favorite place in downtown Phoenix. Great food, drinks and service. Good music too!

RuebcN_OWAlJkMQy7wStJg.text: First time last night on a date at this place and service was horrible!!! I sat at a table and waited for 30 min without no one coming to my table!!! The food is just your regular bar food, nothing special, no one smiles in that morgue either! Will NEVER return!! I just walked out!! Just too many places to go to eat !!!

OMXLIWjME9Rwb7DF_3m59Q.text: This place is awful.no one wears gloves, food is cold, & place is loud.Smoking outside, which shouldn't be at all.Reviews is True

Gz5YKlCeUVMlR7P5iBDaTg.text: Good pub/bar to enjoy and drink with your friends and maybe get some live music. I've only been there on Fridays and Saturdays with the live music. They have a pretty large selection of beers on draft, except no stouts other than Guinness which I was sad about. Oh well.   They have this shot called the "apple pie" shot which was absolutely delicious! It was apple cider, with cinnamon sticks, brown sugar, and everclear and it tastes soooo sweet! Too bad I heard they stopped making them anymore. That was literally their best drink there!  The live music is cool! The food is so-so here. I've had a burger and fries there, and some tater tots and it mostly tasted like cafeteria food! My suggestion is that you eat somewhere else first, then go here to meet up with friends and drink!   Have some Irish car bombs, drink a snake bite or Guinness!
