_nZQC0sxVnGPOxXq1UFoEw.text: I was sitting at the bar, ordered Some drinks and some food, went to the restroom, and a customer moved my seat against a garbage bag (by the bar). I politely asked why this had happened and they laughed at me. The employees did nothing. I've never been disrespected like this at a bar in my entire life - unbelievable.

lsvwT3fBP1KWB9mipADY6g.text: Had the fish and chips before Dierks Bentley concert. Wow!!! Service is good not great but food and ambience make up for it.

qBrxpa93aXGKssRPHetuPA.text: In all fairness I did not try the food so my rating will only refer to the overall experience. I was troubled by how dirty the place seemed. I felt there was a bad smell through out the restaurant and in general the place seemed like it needed some love. I was impressed by the great selection of whiskeys and the staff seemed very friendly, that being said there are better options downtown to try.

YxAqH5oGSAYlAubuKgLbMw.text: Great place to grab a drink. Stopped in to grab a couple drinks with my boyfriend on a Friday night, it was about 8pm. The staff was very kind and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A cab sav and Guinness

j-qznNBlWZQliklXMNLBgA.text: Typical Irish pub with a stone faced bartender. We stopped in for drinks, so I can't speak to the food, but service was good. Not friendly, but prompt.   The bar was pretty empty for a Saturday midday.

X9mMATGc7J9MAbj23y_Ejg.text: Creepy bathroom all the way up the tiny staircase. Dirty everything. This is a perfect dive bar for the downtown crowd. The servers are chill, but they often forget you. If you come here enough, the bartenders remember you. Not that I know.  They have a beautifully vast selection of scotches, so take advantage of that and their cheap prices. Just remember that the reason those prices are so cheap is that they aren't updating the rest of the place. And, you know what? That's perfectly fine by me. Seamus forever!

MqlONOmG44h1GZ9uJZE9cg.text: If you like an Irish Pub this is your place. So much fun. Great bartenders and wonderful food. Would be a blast on St Patty's day!

2mgL-P-E74IN-x6jM-wHzQ.text: Went there last night for halloween.  Was a good crowd, everyone was dressed up and in the spirit.   Ordered a beer.  Big pour on the beer.  Definitely worth it.

qahTQqv67nRmpEBd5o_oXQ.text: This is my go-to "no thought/effort required" bar choice when in Downtown Proper. It never fails - no matter what I happen to be downtown for, dinner at Hanny's, a sports event, a LR adventure, a night at PHX Art (if I'm driving, it's not walking distance from the museum) - and we need a place to have a few beers or cocktails before or after, Seamus is easy and effortless. It's never a destination, but it always gets a visit. Here's why:  The bartenders are always friendly and efficient Prices are reasonable Good draught beer selection Seating is usually available Atmosphere is lively and suitable for one-on-one or group situations There's a jukebox There's food, and it's also reasonably priced for its quality There's a small patio for the smokers out front It's walking distance to most downtown hot spots  There's something to be said for having a Seamus in your pocket when you just want a no-frills pub drink in a friendly atmosphere. It's hard to explain but this place really creates that laid-back old tavern/pub feeling that so many (SO MANY) bars try to reproduce and end up just being another generic bar. I think Christine O. says it best in her review: this place has heart and personality.

FJvPTkDH7gVRXfB4IMKybQ.text: My friends and I had a great time here!   We stopped in for dinner and drinks because we were staying next do at the San Carlos Hotel.   The food was great!   I had the Patty melt and my friend had fish and chips.  They were delish!   The waitstaff was super helpful and friendly.  There was life music in the pub/restaurant too.

OUxUXDkfrY9mLcrLm6vUXA.text: Great food! Fast service. I always favor a place that has a tasty IPA on tap. I shall return.

Eit1ny8zmEqikVQmv8HmJQ.text: Classic Irish Bar. The drinks aren't as stiff as I'd like, but well worth a visit. There are a lot of regulars that lay claim to the bar so you might get stuck with a table.

yEClzMY221mvbko3m_kuGA.text: This is a great Irish Pub, food is good, service is excellent and moderately priced. If you like a late dinner this is the spot for you. People are very friendly, environment is safe and I highly recommend this Pub.

BFg4hVFg84iX1HKKqVuqkw.text: I would move back to the oppressive heat of Phoenix for some of Seamus' vegetable boxty.  Delicious.   I have loved everything I have ever ordered here.  The french fries are pure perfection.  Everyone is super friendly and they have a great beer and whiskey selection.   They open early for football games (not the American kind)--or they used to and the company at that hour makes for an interesting time indeed.

FOHDDxufTLo1hjfGA80Nwg.text: While rockin' the 2011 Comicon experience, you can work up quite a hunger.  We decided to get out of the convention center for a bit, and ended up wandering over to Seamus McCaffrey's for a beer with out lunch.  I had a grilled cheese with bacon and tomato, which was the perfect compromise between the grilled cheese and BLT that I was craving.  Kevin had the beef stew, served with fresh soda bread.  Both meals were tasty and filling, and paired with a Kilt Lifter, the perfect lunch.    The music was at the right level for the crowd, the service was fast and friendly, and there were a few TV's showing Football (Soccer) but not too many to be distracting or annoying.

Y9zEkWkYouTP3XQnPDPRHQ.text: Just ah. I'm not sure why some are raving about the fish and chips. I'm not expecting the quality of fish and chips I experienced in Ireland but I've been to pubs state-side who can do it a lot better than Sesamus McCaffrey's. The breading is very heavy and oily. You can tell they either came out of a bag and fried or a very heavy hand was used with a flour-based bredding. Beer batter makes for a lighter, crispier batter which is a fish and chips signature, and this dish doesn't fit the bill.  The potatoe skins wern't much better. Tasted out of a bag with some cheese and bacon bits (not real bacon pieces) thrown on top with a side of sour cream.  The tables felt really crowded together. The person's chair behind me was touching mine which made dinner awkward. Either the chairs were very low or the tables were high because I felt like I was sitting very low in relation to the table.   I will give them credit for a very nice server and having some local beers on tap. I would say skip the food and come here for a few beers.

eNLOeRGbL3Wx7q0gzFe4FQ.text: 6th stop of the dine around.   Group rated it at 1, I'm bumping it up since I really didn't think it was that bad, just not our type of place.   We came in and were told to seat ourselves, and just ordered the shepherd's pie. Our friend who ordered it was not a fan, but I didn't think it was bad. I'd never had shepherd's pie (a lot of firsts happened for me today), but it didn't resemble anything I was expecting. I actually thought it was pretty good  Though it looks like this place is pretty divey, but a good place to come watch a game or hang out with your buddies

BUvJWBeqCGkjPrL5lXPchg.text: We looked forward to visiting this place after seeing the menu online.  First the good part... the food.  Portions were "normal", and came out in a timely fashion, but we were there during a slow period. There were 2-3 people at the bar and three tables (including us).  Now for the bad.  Since we were there during happy hour, we asked about their HH drink specials.  My husband selected a beer and I asked about the white wine.  Our waitress replied that they had a house Chardonnay.  I asked if they had a different house white besides Chardonnay, like a Sauvignon Blanc, she said "yeah".  Once she brought our drinks and meal, she pretty much forgot about us, in favor of flirting with a guy at the bar.  Even someone from another table had to go up to the front to ask for their bill because she forgot about them, too.  Halfway through the meal we sat with long empty drink glasses trying to waive her over and finally got the attention of a bartender. Of course she was quick to get to that other table to see if she had a tip waiting!  At the close of the meal, our bill showed that we were charged $8 per glass of wine.  I asked her why we were charged $8 and she left for a few minutes.  Then she came back with a wine menu (which we had never seen before) and pointed out the different wines on the menu and that the Sauvignon Blanc was $8 (which she could not pronounce correctly). I repeated to her our previous conversation, how I was inquiring about the HH wine special.  So why on Earth didn't she say that the Sauvignon Blanc was not a part of the HH special???  She just looked down, said she was sorry but she didn't hear me say HOUSE just "white wine" and that she didn't know what else to do.  Awkward silence.... for a long time. If that's how they want to play it, fine. What would have been her tip simply ended up in the hands of the restaurant.  There are other places to go with great food and servers who know their job and deserve their tips.

4C3e5vlIRidZDHSVyO-Tnw.text: I can't decide which is worse...the food or the service. Actually, yes I can. The service bites big time. For a table of eight, you'd think you might wanna check back once, maybe even twice. Or at least make eye contact for Pete's sake! As for the food, the Shepherd's pie is a big No! How can you mess up Shepherd's pie? It was similar to Sloppy Joes or Hamburger Helper? Hey, maybe it's Sloppy Joe Hamburger Helper???The Chicken Boxty was not bad with big chunks of bell pepper-yum-but I think I detected a tinny flavor to the chicken. I wonder if they buy Chicken-in-a-Can @ Costco. Seriously??? The waitress STILL is not back!  Okay, I've simmered down since I originally drafted this. The service did suck, the food was okay, but what do we expect from a pseudo Irish bar, anyhow? :)

ODsJnZXFenMdAQtUU4PrUg.text: Great place to drink late at night. The last bar to close in the downtown area. Good drinks and everyone keep to themselves. Great place to meet the locals.

DFM8gBYK7orctnjl9BMfTg.text: So, it's your typical Irish style pub, dark, dank, loud w/plenty of seating in a side section, and typical long straight bar stools.  The locals made it interesting and fun, I was able to witness some shennanigans one night that was rather comical (see below). the outdoor seating is minimal, but supports a crowd of 15 or so, with mist gently falling from overhead water spouts to keep you cool(er). The staff was great, the bartending on point and the bouncer was able to diffuse a potentially ugly situation. Overall it's one of the best and most hoppin' spots in downtown.  Decent pub style food, large portions, good prices? What more do you need? Oh yeah, brew selection. Good pints w/local flavors on tap, bottles, full hard liquor selection too. A good spot/loction for a few pints if in downtown AZ,   PS SO, sitting outside enjoying a few brews on the solo tip 11pm ish? Three younger shaved headed guys, seriously vocal, decide they need to start chanting F#*K the IRISH, in the pub. The bouncer proceeds to get them out into the street where I witnessed some KnuckleHeadedNess I have not viewed since my college days. One dude says, you know hat time it is? Shirts off! (wishing I had a camera in hand) Then they proceed to scream PUNCH ME! Punch Me!! After 3 or 4 shots it was over, but the whole build up and theatrical show was worth the wait. And the shining knights of young male testostorone jumped into a taxi, off into the night. I was told by the bouncer this is unusual, but like plenty of drinking spots, there's always the potential, it's how you handle it, and he deserves and  A+ and maybe a shiny gold star.

Vrrd7PzUQuVwZl9WQoEAog.text: Seamus is quick sort of, easy sort of, and its not bad. There always seems to be a group of douche bags at the entry that might be security, might just be guys who are friends with the bar staff. Either way in three trips, they were always there and annoying as hell.   The food is...meh (to quote my rating). I had the Chicken Parmesan, I am pretty sure it was Chicken tenders. Either way it was not anything special.   Not a bad place to go to before going to a game or show. It won't be as busy as the spots right down town. If it is busy though, don't wait. You'll only get angry that you waited.

OAqTzaoI1Cu1JAo9cDrmYQ.text: Had lunch here while in town for work, and later stopped back for a beer.  Food was average bar food, though they do that portion the ketchup thing (rather than have bottles at the table, or brought to the table, they bring out portions in little cups) which I think is silly.  My teriyaki chicken sandwich was just so-s0, but not bad.  There were like 6 people in the whole place, but the service was not all that attentive.  There was some good gossip happening as you could see all the staff clustered together chatting during our entire meal.  Later, the place was much busier, but the service at the bar - just to drink beer - was no better.  I'd go back, but I'd look for someplace as an alternative first.

ukLeYwP3_265gyRunoJuhA.text: Stopped in three times now.  Standard Irish pub offerings of many Irish whiskeys and Guinness.  Tried the chicken pie and fish and chips.  Pretty OK.  Same as anywhere.  Randy was bar tending each time.  Shares a knowledge way beyond his years.  OK if you take it with a grain of salt.  Beware!  If decent looking female clientele arrives, your service will seriously degrade.

HijP5GeungTy-oT9jQ8W7g.text: The place seem to ONLY serve as a quick stop for people attending a downtown event to get a drink or two prior to the event (The Dodge Theater, Suns or Diamondbacks).  Crowds come early and leave soon there after ... some may return after the event but I wouldn't count on it.  The peeps are either sports fans and/or music fans that enjoy seeing a show sitting down in a cushy seat (i.e. The Dodge Theater).  The fish dinner is good and Brittany the waitress even better (I'm a "big fan") ... but all-in-all ... not my cup of tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dwe6TN5HzYBXLMxDAxFHVg.text: Let's face it, locals.  Downtown Phx doesn't exactly have a bunch of places you can duck into and call home.  Seamus McCaffrey's is one of those places.  If you've come here for fine cuisine, you'll be disappointed.  The food here is good, not great.  But if you're here, you've usually eaten elsewhere already and are looking to wet your whistle.  And for that, you're in the right place.  Service is quick on all but the busiest nights, prices are reasonable, and the crowd is always fun.  Live bands do perform here fairly often, but their days rotate.  It not unusual to show up one night on week and enjoy a live band's performance, then come back the same night next week and have them not be there.  If live music is what you're after, call first.  Parking in this area is generally a chore, especially around Happy Hour.  Parking spaces can be found a block or so away as night falls, but the best option (as with most anything downtown) is to take the Light Rail and walk the short block to the pub.  In short, it's a very laid-back kind of place.  Like stopping off at a friend's house for a drink and a chat before carrying on with your evening.

XegVShyDSwfdEB2wzeqUSg.text: Please Read: I watched the bartender walk out of the bathroom zipping up his fly and went right back behind the bar like nothing happened.  I'm going to assume he did not wash his hands. Neat little bar to say the least, but that's just flat out disgusting. When we went to confront a different waitress, we we're just ignored.  Never again.

u194CWFVpk00qNkCqTwiOA.text: Came here to wait for check in at the Hotel San Carlos. They were showing the Celtics game on TV which was cool. Randy was the bartender that you hope to see at an Irish bar. All in all a nice place to come and hang out

NfL-9203Vm56mymw_JPO6A.text: As I walked into Seamus McCaffrey's, I felt like I was in a serious downtown. If I hadn't known better, I could have said I was in a Chicago or San Francisco. This bar was jumping with locals, live music bounced off the walls and character filled the room.   The bar is divey, it's cozy, it's dark and it's awesome. The drinks are cheap, the patrons are awesome and there's plenty of seating. Downtown Phoenix could use about 15 more types of these bars.   I visited Seam McCaffrey's after a Diamondbacks game and it was so cool to see Downtown Phoenix alive and bustling on a Friday night. This bar is like a little taste of what the entire Downtown Phoenix area could be like if we took every bar and restaurant filled with character like this and placed them on the same block. Having just got back from Chicago, this bar definitely reminded me of the character the Chicago bars have and it really made my night to see it!   So bottoms up Seamus McCaffrey's! You make Phoenix proud!

plnksI-2ZRyUt6koAtyTOg.text: Seamus McCaffrey's is kind of generic when it comes to Irish pubs. Not really homey, but not a generic bar either. It's somewhere in between. Probably has something to do with the generic-ness of its downtown location.   I enjoy myself whenever I'm there but that's more due to present inebriated company than to the establishment itself. Haven't had any of the food there so I can't vouch for their pub grub, but the bartenders are pretty friendly and real patient with some of the more stupored clientele (which includes a few regulars but also a lot of tourists & business travelers staying at nearby hotels). But as far as being an ultimate Irish pub, I'm afriad Seamus isn't it.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h0i4jhXyCMwW0IWpI1y0MQ.text: Irish pub with a great whiskey selection, a generous pour and good fish and chips. Service at the bar is great; not so at tables.

MGF_OTLno2IV9m2Ae_s-ZA.text: if you like being around a diverse crowd this place is for you. I personally like people who wear who they are on their sleeve. This place is really cool. We looked for places to eat on a Saturday in downtown Phoenix and this place is where we landed. Irish bar concept with amazing food. I had the French dip. I have this everywhere I go and this place was too notch. Cool people and good vibes

2yac4jVoI1ocLNjsUWWLZQ.text: Who would have known there's a good Irish pub in the desert! After my original flight got delayed, I finally arrived in PHX at 8pm. Hungry and slightly pissed that I lost a whole day of my vacation, I vowed to make a night out of it (at least not go straight to my place of lodging). Downtown Phoenix is a maze, not in a good way. Between the one way street, the split lane (due to light rail track) and limited parking, we finally parked at the Chase Tower parking garage (ended up being $6) and walked toward lights and sound.  I saw this place came with high marks on yelp, so while it wasn't topical for my desert vacation, I can't really say no to a good Irish pub.   First impression, great door/security guy.  He checked our IDs, introduced himself and the place (kitchen opens til midnight, drinks til 2am), and said let him know if we need a cab.   We sat ourselves, ordered a pint each ($5.50 for imperial pint, I had Smithwicks Irish ale) and wings and chips and gravy.  I asked for the gravy to come on the side, so I don't know if its normally drenched in it, but even if it is you won't mind, because that's AWESOME gravy!  A small hint of curry, savory, I would have licked the bowl (wait... I did lick the bowl).  Wings were ok, a little too saucy. And the medium has quite a kick.  Service was ok, waitress was a little absent at times but I was in no hurry.  My favorite part of the night was the live music. It's always nice to have an Irish band in an Irish pub. I don't know if it is typical of them to have an Irish live band, but I hope they do.   Solid joint even for a visitor who wasn't expecting a St Paddys take two.

Vl4coRW7BRkpvS_TM8vKXw.text: Seamus was just one stop on my birthday pub crawl.  They play live Irish music, which I really enjoyed!  Very festive.   Our server was pretty nice and attentive.  I think the drinks were good, but to be quite honest, I don't really remember that much!  But we did spend a pretty long time there, so that says something!

NJvNkaU9gXFXkGJtzlLeYw.text: If you're into dive bars/Irish pubs, you'll love Seamus'. I'm not. I went with a few friends after the Rattlers game, and yeah .. not my scene. But the guys I was with that LOVE that sort of thing, rave about this place.

H-uYaW1qHCILYEc2ukblrA.text: A great place to grab a beer in Downtown. I've never had the food but I do enjoy a pint at the bar whenever I'm walking down in the area.

7za5SwAd4TxV9NVZLKV4ww.text: Went here w my bro for my birthday. Loved it. Super casual, yummy beverage choices. Great crowd of weird people. (Seemed to be a costume event somewhere around town???) Anyways, it was a great way to go out, chill and have a couple of drinks for my bday. I will definitely go again! (Been trying to talk my fiance into in since we moved to downtown...) Also, GREAT music (nostalgic) and the other people were super kind and patient, considering how packed it was... Awesome atmosphere!

jHsyZs12do7aMVVV-R_xSg.text: So far so good. Nice atmosphere.  Friendly service. Great selection of whisky. I haven't tried the food yet but when I do, I'll let you know.

LtV7DyWu421XHJtAvP7VVw.text: Beware how much $$$ you give the bartender, likes to shortchange ya! Never that drunk that I don't know how much I am due back :(

LxRQNiUbohHcLkpV1zjfBQ.text: Great ambiance for the Euro 2012 soccer games. Convenient location downtown. Awesome grilled cheese sandwiches and mammoth sized Chef Salad. House made ranch dressing is very good. If you want to celebrate "5 o'clock somewhere" is is a great place to grab a pint.

3lNdnJxlKenNhgQl5Th0Xw.text: Great Fish and Chips.  Nothing better than haven them with a Pint of Guiness and a couple of fingers of Jamesons.

qUlZmPr8Ox8wUo0MGPF_BQ.text: Solid 3.5 Stars I've been here more times than I can count, but not as many times as I have gone to Seamus' brother bar, The Turf.   I have eaten and been a slight bit tipsy at both places.  What I am not fond of here is the bottle neck at the bar area....try getting in and out of here on even a semi busy night...and unless you are sitting at a table or find a spot to order at the bar you shall remain drinkless.    Thus I prefer this place after work during the week and I tend to avoid super busy nights like First Fridays or St Patricks.  [I lie I enjoyed the trolly they had set up to take patrons back and forth last year between Turf and Seamus for St Patties].  The food is good but not great. The beer is cold and when you have a seat (at the bar or table) the service is usually good.

Nw5IdFO6D-StRJNKaGZ51Q.text: This is just another trash bar in downtown. The service was so bad we did not even get past the first drink. Not only was the place dirty it smelled the way it looked. We decided to have a beer and play darts but, that was a mistake. They give us 6 of the same yellow darts which fall apart in your hand and act as though they are a gold. I went up to explain that we needed another dart cause they are falling apart one of the tips bounced somewhere in the bar. I was told not only am I not getting another dart but if I don't find the tip, I'm not getting my drivers license back. We immediately handed the darts back, demanded the license and left. There are much better places to spend your money.

ThEsko18pi6abe-Jc44eoQ.text: Waitress was very friendly and provided great service.  Steak boxty was tasty and filling.  Went well with a pint of Harp.

7lQ_xOfRmIFUYclkmPHJng.text: I stopped here just before the [Title of Show} OYE event to grab some dinner. I love an Irish pub! The location was very convenient - right downtown, just a few blocks from the theater and the light rail. I imagine if I were a visitor at staying at the San Carlos Hotel I would be regularly stopping in for at least a drink.  That said I went for my usual - Fish and Chips. Original, I know. The menu indicated no newspaper - which is fine. I also ordered a draught of Four Peaks magical Kilt Lifter brew. The waiter brought the drink quickly - I had asked if there were any happy hour specials. The special was 50 cents of a draught. Not very happy, is it? So instead of $4.50 for the beer, it was $4. I think I prefer the same brew at San Felipe's in Tempe for $2.25 during happy hour....the size of the fish was good. Two filets - and by filet that is what it looked like - two Filet o' Fish from McDonalds. Just a size comparison - the taste was fine. The fries were good and I had everything I needed. But for me, it wasn't anything fantastic. If you blindfolded me, took me inside and removed the blindfold, I could be at any Irish pub in the city - or any city for that matter. The side dish of cole slaw was not very creamy, but it wasn't bad. All in all, the meal was fine, but just par for the fish & chips course.  The atmosphere was a little interesting - so I didn't mind having a Kilt Lifter in an Irish pub. The tables were regular tables rather than old wooden ones found in many Irish pubs and the music playing was country...Huh? Country in an Irish pub just seemed like an odd combo.   An order of fish & chips along with 2 Kilt Lifters came to just under $18. Again, a little pricey for what was provided for an otherwise average experience.

We have been here a few times and each time the service is attentive and the food is of great quality! Go here to try something different. =) You don't be disappointed!

LsAd6cnjeY9WJQruo6fb4g.text: Kinda divey & dark. It wasn't busy when we went mid Sunday (it was Mother's Day & the Dbacks we're playing). It seemed like just a few regulars were hanging out. We were looking for live music so moved on after one drink. Bartender was friendly. The decor was really cool. Just wish there was more life in the place. We will try again soon though.

gjzPSVnIzToXBfmCtCWXrg.text: One of the best laid back places to hang out in Downtown Phoenix.  Yes it's old and it shows but seriously who cares, it takes decades to develop the kind of character it has anyways.  One strange thing about the place is the restrooms are upstairs.  It

Q8oRcDq67BXUiE78Zp_ixw.text: I do love a good dive bar. Exactly what I needed after travelling to Phoenix for business. Airports make me thirsty guys. Very pleasant wait/bar staff and a lively crowd even on a week night. My local guide/cousin says it's one of her faves and I can see why. Good atmosphere and well priced.

6Sqh-ecRoJNE33HLHasAWQ.text: It is in downtown Phoenix, so you will pay for parking.  I was with a convention group of friends and on street parking is 1.50 per hour up to 4 hours at night.  Personally, I think it is a rip off for the city to charge you to park on the street at night after 5 or 6 PM but that is just me.    It is an Irish pub theme with a pretty good size bar, tables and booths with a full bar.  They also have a small outside seating area with metal tables and chairs.  It has a typical "Irish" pub menu and have bottle beer and draught beer (+1).  I had the fish and chips which the waitress (wait person, waiter, wait staff) told me the this was a signature dish.    I found it to be OK and a pretty good portion size, but not nothing to write home about.  It is an OK place and would stop again if I can sit outside so give it a 3 rating.

sL3EMjjO9_K39IssXboPyQ.text: Meeh...  it was OK... The bar has an amazing selection of whiskeys and some creative flights to try.  The price is reasonable.   I asked my server for her opinion on the food and ignored her suggestion (chicken pot pie) because I was in a beef mood.  I should have listened.  The steak and Guinness stout was OK.  The meat was tender but the gravy was thinner than I had expected; more like stew with a small potato pancake floated on the top.  The soda bread was a small but sufficient portion. My server was nice and efficient. I would call it more like 3.5 but can't go 4 because of the thin gravy.

2Ffh5dKJ5jayS1FUXWjryQ.text: Went here before and after a concert at The Van Buren.  Really enjoyed having a draft Guinness and a slice of the Irish Whiskey cake even though it looked NOTHING like the picture associated with it on their website.  The service was good.  Fun and relaxed ambiance.

y_riJVjoFwXMJ3V4KPRY8A.text: Great little place that makes for a great afternoon hangout on the weekends. Staff is always professional and polite, always exceeding expectations. Bartenders knowledge of the vast amount of whiskey's and beer available is remarkable. This is one of the few bar staffs that get things right every time. Leah  is an absolute extraordinary server and bar tender that always goes out of the way to make sure people are well taken care of. This is one place to go very hungry as the portions are very large

uFHmVLfk_fQmpRbtDrqhCg.text: Great place.  Had some beer and a burger.  Staff was friendly.  Beer was cold, burger was not.  Nice happy hour kind of place.    Hmmm,. I guess I clicked 5 stars too early.  All the smokers arrived and just stank it up.

DSe7GmkgZSu5g5LPxSn5uQ.text: Wonderful service and very consistent. My husband and I enjoy coming here before basketball games. We stop my for beer and a plate of Irish nachos

w7Dx_GoSHKXiHx_fG9XkTQ.text: Great Fish and Chips.   Love the atmosphere too.  Leah was my waitress.  Awesome!  Prices are good too.

wpammCAakciXm2yxwYryzg.text: One of my fave Irish pubs. Extensive selection of whiskeys/whiskys. And the fish platter may be the best in the valley! Also,  great pub ambience! When downtown,  a must visit!

xk6x29Xg4smLeUmRMe3uww.text: This place is the real deal. Great atmosphere very authentic I had a blast I didn't try any of the food but I will definitely go back for drinks again.

KUbXJYqlKfa1PndxgThVdg.text: I was craving True Irish fare when I embarked upon this establishment. Of course, Sheppards Pie was in my cross hairs. It was very good!   The menu I thought would be a little more traditional Irish. However, it had all of your traditional American favorites and bar staples with an inter-mingling of Irish culinary treats tossed in. My server was very attentive an ensured that my drink was replenished and needs were attended too. Good place for nibble and a pop if your in the downtown area... #vino2ultimate #vinosquared

y5_zFOii6_ltaYfVELXgwg.text: Go for the drinks - great bar and amazing whiskey selection.. std Irish food is really below par.  Probably better to go with burgers and basic sandwiches.    I had a terrible Caesar salad and a less then desirable Steak and Mushroom pie.

eSt6GEVl7zoRn0RGimQ-lA.text: We are 100% Irish couple and this bar is clearly Irish owned compared to other "Irish bars" we loved it the atmosphere the food the barmaid leah etc  it was pretty authentic considering it's technically in the desert.

rk8xrTBZsMqaWFiZSmr2Fg.text: Awesome place and excellent, efficient service.Cold Guinness beer, Sheperd's pie, fish and chips, and the onion rings were perfect. The atmosphere is pretty relaxed and laid back. Will go back.

2YSvoDpHrbAl3VcFeKWHVA.text: The Guinness is shit. Slop that I wouldn't give a barren sow and they couldn't even put it in a proper glass.  If your looking for a good pint of stout go across the street.

7mEQz_574FzZ8X45z-JXCQ.text: Angry server, terrible food but great beers.  Yup, a real pub like you'll find back in Ireland. Go for the beer and pub atmosphere but eat next door at rice paper.

Tm0o1l8cQbXcYdTVcil65w.text: Ate there solo and then went back later to have a drink with a friend while he ate.  We each had the chicken pot pie which was incredibly good.  Very satisfied with the portion, taste and service.  I'm downgrading it because the music was way too loud on base, and was rap / hip-hop which was completely wrong for the name and decor of the place.  Easy fix, management!

fQak3sBSzKMNutpKDHBndg.text: We went on a Friday evening before a show at the Orpheum Theater. It was busy but that was to be expected. The service was good, the food was good, not stellar but certainly not bad, they did have the Bushmill's girls walking around with free shots which was a big plus. They also had strong bow cider on tap. This is pure WIN in my opinion.  Pros:  Good Food Good Service Fun environment  Cons: Obnoxious drunks (to be expected at almost any bar) Parking SUCKS but its down town what do you expect.

HHuM5DAzbLRZB_yYWZYTIA.text: Hopped on the light rail (first time ever) with the kiddos and the hubby, and stopped downtown to find a place to eat.  After a little bit of wandering, we ended up here.  I have to say, I'm a sucker for Irish pubs.  I practically live at Fibber Magees after all. I'll start with the good:  The waitress was adorable and attentive.  We never had empty glasses, and the food was served promptly.  The steak and Guinness boxty was amazing, and the Jamison's cake was to die for!  The kids meal quesadilla was big enough to feed 2 kids (mine are 5 and 6 and HUGE eaters) which was good since it was 6..75! The bowl of soup was reasonably priced at 4.95, and the bowl was big! Now for the not so good:  Kind of a hole-in-the-wall.  It could most definitely use some updating.  Every table/chair in the place looked well-worn and some had flat out holes and large rips.  The Guinness was pretty pricey at $6.00, and served in the same glass as the water and iced tea.  The thing that got me the most was the fact that you have to go up and entire flight of stairs to use the restroom!  Now, I'm not the world's most coordinated person, and there's a reason I don't really wear heels anymore, but all I could think of was how many ladies out there wear those crazy 5" shoes and how easy it would be to have one drink too many and fall down the stairs on your way back from the bathroom!  Also, when you have small children, that's a danger as well.  And if your small children are like mine, then you can't visit any establishment EVER without using the bathrooms! All in all, we had a nice time here, the food was good, and the waitress was cool.  Nothing super-special that would demand I return immediately, but nothing so bad that I'd never come back either.  This place is A-OK!

orlkVd6gRfo-QGItzOKGDQ.text: Got to this restaurant after another restaurant literally laughed at my group of 4 and told us that we would be waiting a loooooooong time for her service because she was so busy!! So we said adios to that place...not going to pay to be treated poorly! We walked into this restaurant and the hostess was so warm and friendly and told us to pick any table! What a pleasant change of attitude between a restaurants! We had a great server, wish I remembered her name...and food was very good. When in an Irish pub eat like an Irishman...I got the corned beef and cabbage boxty! It was so good! I didn't want the corned beef or the potato pancake to ever be gone! Everyone else enjoyed their meals, the only bummer was the obnoxious group that came in and sat right next to us! Even our sweet server was annoyed with them! Haha! I guess it's good I don't remember her name...but seriously those peeps were so loud!! Anyway...good service, good food...ambiance was a little lacking...and my soda bread with my meal wasn't served warm...hence my star deduction...But if you want good food and good service...this could fit your bill!!

LuGzCrVQGnBw-5_PsKujeA.text: Always a blast on St. Pat's day and good bands.  Normal nights a good event with strong cocktails and patio for cigar smoking'.

fw_axRp5Stcv6D-kGq609A.text: I always have the best time at Seamus. It gets real there. Four stars because of the atmosphere. I can drink cheaper some places and eat better food at Rose and Crown but Seamus is where to party. Still good food and definitely great beer. Happy hour is an awesome time to go.

5ivMhCiNp9go41Ct73lkuw.text: BTW Again I don't like doing bad reviews or even do reviews if I can let the business know how they are being represented. To End My Shameful Seamus Experience (read my first review on this place). I reported them to the BBB and have a complaint on file that the owner is to respond to by a certain time. By no surprise that time line passed and I recieved an email from the BBB asking if they had responded and then an apology when they hadn't. I honestly didn't care about this anymore and truly forgot about it because Seamus is a laughable attempt at the idea of a neighborhood bar of which, and here's the funny part, that I'm 86'd from for life. I never went there! No judgment on any of the customers as many of them are friends or aquaintences. I don't support places that are managed terribly but then I got the phone call...from the owner. WOW. The reason why that place always looks filthy, or have mentally unstable bartenders and management in training mangers who have no idea what the customer experience is further do not care about the image of the business, or how the bathrooms just look like a drug deal was just done or why the place just looks like a sad afterthought is, drum roll please, The Owner Doesn't Care! It all makes sense. After speaking with him and just letting him know what's happening is his business he immediately became unnecessarily defensive. When asked "why I was kicked out" he replied "because I didn't get kicked out quietly". Ok 2 + 2 is like 42 that equation. To be clear I got kicked out for wanting an explanation of why I was being escorted out. Ok fine kick me out for asking questions but explain why I was kicked out to begin with?   NO ONE AT THIS PLACE CAN OR HAS OR WILL EVER BE ABLE TO.   He went on to tell me that because I told the female bartender how I truly felt about her as I was being escorted out again for being a customer, that I was 86'd for life.   "Lol. I don't like Seamus, never have as it one of the worst... (click) "  He hung up on me. Yup.  As a business owner I would think that if someone who NEVER goes to SEAMUS, actually despises Seamus , a non customer who is going out of there way let him/her know the image.of his business that Is going out by these heavily undertrained staff so much so to get the BBB involved, this is probably something to have an open mind about and look into the situation. And be able to answer very simple questions. If you can't tell me why I was asked to leave it is because I was discrimated against for personal reasons and or views of from your so called "bartender". Just man up and say that. Use your head. If she was "offduty" why was she calling the shots when I had been seen and waited on by several of the other bartenders? I saw this girl for 3 min and was asked to leave.   He stated "I have witness's". I have witnesses as well who are regulars there and witnessed the entire display. He didn't care. This is why you establishment sucks.  You suck. (All due respect)

QWtgm1yAxS4kpLUZyUsf6g.text: Definitely a return visit. Great atmosphere and the food is very good. My wife and I split the Guinness steak boxty and for the extra dollar they gave us 2 good size plates of food and extra bread. Very nice. Like 2 meals for the price of one. Steak was super tender and Guinness gravy was delightful.

Y4_2Fj0zaqMwdtwVR3pUbQ.text: Me and my wife came here very nice with the live music very talented fellow. cheaper beers then the other places has a real a hometown Bar feel I like it

1lBXbp9t764hSeqduc4RlA.text: It's what you expect from an Irish pub. One of my favorite bars downtown. It's an old building with a lot of character. Great place to have a drink...

C8t5pKNfzpdaH8YSFDVEpQ.text: Well unfortunately today was the last day I will go to Seamus due to their lack of respect and value for their regular costumers.  I have worked on the other side of the block for the last 4 years.  My office has approximately 40 people and frequently groups of us will order food from here. I have also ordered food from here for my work potlucks.   Today I understand is the busiest and probably most profitable day of the year.  The rudeness I experienced from some of the staff (original server was amazing and super nice) over two $10 wristbands was disappointing.  (We were there when it was free. We had to go back to the office and wanted to return a little while later). They would not give us the wristbands without paying $20.   You just lost multiple regular costumers over $20.   I will not suggest Seamus to my co-workers for lunch again.

HbliiC52sxa74XpAS2zBLA.text: This place has the most single malt scotch's in all of Arizona, the staff is great and the food.....holy Irish mothers its the BOMB!!!!

cVXgYsbX8UJJM-OgJyWbeQ.text: Good pub food is a lovely thing to have downtown, especially when Seamus is a regular after-work stopping point. My coworkers are pretty cool cats and we've been here several times after the office closes to get a few drinks. Seamus is where I had my first Irish Car Bomb. Guinness is positively delightful and I could drink it every day.  The service is polite, the food is very good and the price is reasonable. I couldn't begin to tell you how much I love fish and chips. And Guinness. Maybe that should be my request for a final meal, if I'm ever put on Death Row and the prison offers such a last request.

meFp3xNr0Gw8jK_tPUoIUA.text: We stopped here after getting a hotel in Downtown Phoenix. The bartender was very friendly and guided us on choosing a scotch from their extensive menu. I had an Ardbeg, and at $8 it wasn't a horrible price. Beers were good - I had a couple pints of some local Arizona beer as well.  This is truly a hole in the wall type place and is very comfortable. Vintage looking but not run down at all. Great service and welcoming environment. Plus, they actually enforce the no smoking inside which is great!  I would rate at 4.5 stars given the slightly expensive price, but I'll round to 5 just because Arizona is awesome.

rJR6ZkMLGmBAsY5H3ZfTfA.text: The Food? Only if you have to.  The Bathroom?  Only if you have to.    So why the five stars?  Because it does what it's supposed to extremely well.  The second I walk in I hear "hey Dante" from the bartender as he pours me a Guinness.  Can you say that about a bar in town?  I can sit with friends on the patio and people watch.  You'll likely hear Bob Barker or see Cliff.  You'll notice the alley or like to call it "narnia" for the fact that no one who walks down it ever walks out as the same person.  You can sit on the patio of Seamus and judge the people at Ghost Lounge.  You see life walking around and can do it with a cigarette in one hand and beer in the other.

kyOIxtLsKC2_mc3uSFbPKg.text: Nice St Patty's Day celebration - everything outside! A little pricey on Irish Stew but very tasty! $10 cover to pay for Irish band, tent, & port-a-pot. Reasonable beer prices

7RtyrFWheoTldIFu9kxdug.text: Love this place..  Now that some of the old bartenders are gone its great.. I always leave much more hammered than when I got there.. good thing I can walk home..

xDEWKla-O8BLZUzPQCRsPA.text: Walked in on Sunday. Had the potato skins just to start.... frozen/reheated processed... bad food... bar service experience was worse.... service with an attitude.....pass on by........

Q2g9FaA8AOE62gsKH6nmcA.text: Went there for some late night grubs after First Friday. I've been a couple times before as it's really just a fun place to get some yummy Irish food (oh how I love thee!) and drinks. And they have hard cider which is a total bonus in my book. They had a fantastic live band playing some kickin' Irish tunes and the staff was super friendly. I only wish they had bangers and mash on the menu, but oh well.

hWluGErmcIWqsRFE2FagiQ.text: A very, very upbeat restaurant - a good lively atmosphere.  Also, the food (I had the shrimp & fish) tasted very good and the service time was excellent - this is great especially if you are on a time crunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AVQ8I2PZvfixllAxaru_2A.text: I enjoyed this place so much with hubs.  He and I both love live music- Music period! This is a good place for that while I can enjoy and observe my new environment. We were just spending the night here in Phoenix before our long excursion to the Grand Canyons so we thought we'd check out this city.  There was a huge baseball game, the Cubs and idk the opponent but anyway, before and after this game, people gathered-young and not too old.  lol It was fun whilst a little bit of whisky here and there. Okay, a few... The best part is the live band. They were very versatile in their music choices they played.  Every song they played was a hit and then some requests were also played.  This is an Irish pub and you know how these guys are when they party?  You too will sure join along. Some had a little much end up falling off their chairs but weren't violent though. Just had a little much fun I think and somehow survived until the band was done with their sets.  There's plenty of foods , coffee and not tea but a whole lot of other stuff. Don't miss this when you are in the area. I wish I can remember the band but I don't. Sorry... Hubs and I had an awesome night here.

px5xWXq15b8-IUIykQW7Yw.text: Very lively full restaurant that is full of music, talk and lots of patrons.  The live music energizes the restaurant and when I was there on a Friday night it was quite full.  The food was good, I ordered the house salad and was pleasantly surprised how large and tasty it was.  Some patrons are just there to drink and chat, but there are tables to sit down and have a meal.  The noise level is such that dinner conversation requires effort and when the live music starts you can pretty much forget any table talk.  This restaurant definitely has character and is usually busy.

_CPi3GFJCQ60bwHR9y41_A.text: Stop by! You won't be disappointed. After our nights out downtown we usually end up here. Super fun laid back Irish bar. I've been when there is a band and when there wasn't. All times have been equally fun. Bartenders are cool and the food is so yummy, surprisingly yummy!   Bought some peeps visiting from Texas and they enjoyed the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Irish Nachos

sBxZOELTTV_6VSfqi7Pt4w.text: I read reviews as I walked in and they almost made me turn and walk out. I was very nervous about coming in because the place look like a man cave rather than a bar that was female friendly. I am so glad that my husband and I decided to stay for drinks and dinner !   The service was impeccable from the waitress we had. She was warm and very helpful. She suggested several things that were perfect for us when I told her how picky I was.   The wings were meaty and had a good flavor. The Irish nachos were amazing! Prices were very decent. My husband enjoyed his whiskey flight.   The lack of 5 stars is not for service but for overall appeal - the entrance was crowded with smokers, the bar was full of loud gentleman cursing and the "chotzkis" on the walk were dusty. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit but if I wasn't tired and hungry I would have just walked right back out.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Irish whiskey flight
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good beer options

x2XX3l5HzqCPpDl7sXm1Eg.text: We were wandering about in downtown Phoenix on a weeknight, and the decision (not mine) was made to give this Irish pub a try.   It's been around forever, but we've never set foot into it before, although my Beloved has always been curious about it. Although she's a non-drinker, she has this fascination with English, Irish, Scottish and Welsh pubs.    I had the corned beef and cabbage, which was a humongous dish. The meat and cabbage were pretty good, but the dish lacked excitement. The cabbage needed more cooking. I think they should have added some onions and a bit more pepper to it in order to liven it up.  If you're starving, however, you can feed yourself, plus about three other hungry people just with the one plate.    My wife had the Irish beef stew, which she liked quite a bit. When I tasted it, however, it reminded me a bit of Dinty Moore. I liked the notes of celery and tomato in the thick, gravy-like broth. But, just like the corned beef, I felt it needed more of a kick to make it truly outstanding. Some more garlic, maybe a dash of Tabasco, and I think the stew would have stood out more.  The soda bread, however, was something we both liked. We had nice, thick slices which we slathered enthusiastically with the fresh butter.   Although the restaurant wasn't a super-exciting place, the experience was decent.   At least we finally satisfied my Beloved's curiosity.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QnpCDOgBWs1soSXN3ebmwg.text: I went here for dinner recently. Didn't give the best first impression when there were smokers gathered around out front, but inside was a fun Irish pub with a pretty decent menu. I ordered a French dip & it was delivered in less than 5 minutes. Pretty impressive speed, a friendly & personal server, & within walking distance of a lot of what downtown Phoenix has to offer. Worth a visit!

C7RgG51sfmrAtM7XqO63UQ.text: This is an old establishment so don't expect anything else. The staff is super friendly. They have decent draft beer prices and it was all greens for me so I only had a house salad with Italian dressing. The place was busy for a Monday. If you want to relax and enjoy a decent meal and good drinks this is a good spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h33eSCCgj85RYU56D08Fqg.text: Bloody Mary here is delicious - great service and the bar is what an Irish pub should be - ridiculous amounts of drink options with very solid food to go with.  Stop in for a reprieve from life - leave happy.

RVcKSpDnY2J20rl2onxS_Q.text: I really used to like this place.  Dark dive bar that served food late night and was always cool on a hot Phoenix night.  It still is all of that but the food has gone down hill and there are other options in Downtown Phoenix that serve good Irish Pub food and / or are open late night.  Bar - 4 stars.  Great bartenders that pour stiff drinks and are generally on top of things.  The place does get a little crowded and the bar is a little long.  If there is only one bartender behind the bar he or she can miss you if you are on the other end.  5 - star scotch / whiskey selection.  Food - 3 stars.  I used to really like the Rueben and the Chicken Pot Pie.  Unfortunately both have declined.  They don't grill the rye bread in butter anymore I think they just toast it. The Chicken Pot pie crust is not good.  The fish and chips are good and the fish sandwich is good too.  I still come here for the drinks and the cool dive bar air conditioning but the food used to be a lot better.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 5 star scotch whiskey selection.
Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Rueben. I wish it was grilled not toasted

HYlxlFRCpU5lU1vywkFuXg.text: Great downtown Irish bar with awesome bartenders who are attentive and just nice to engage with. You can usually catch some good music here too, which is a total plus when looking for an affordable alternative to the Phoenix live music scene. As an Irish bar, there is a crazy selection of whiskey, but honestly, this place might have the largest selection of spirits I've ever seen. Seriously, the entire length of the bar is deep with selection.

i2OxP2qfoovClbk9_Xhq0A.text: It's about 9PM, and we are tired from being in meetings and cooped up in the hotel for several days. We decided to find a bar to escape from the mundane hotel food. The first bar we found (forgot the name) was a bit yuppy and did not have any seats or tables available (as in, everyone was standing due to lack of furniture). I then yelped really quickly and found this place. Yay, they were still open!   As we were a party of 9, we easily found a table inside the air conditioning. This restaurant wraps around a bit, so be sure you explore all the nooks and crannies if you are looking for a place to sit. About 5 minutes after we sat down, the waitress greeted us and took our drink orders. I will say that service all night was good - appropriate but not overbearing. This place is also capable of splitting a check so that each person could individually pay; there was no surcharge for having a party of 9.  I ordered the macaroni and cheese, and this is why I give three stars. The cheese was baked onto the pasta, but it was not a liquid, creamy gold like at the Pit Room in Houston. The pasta's texture was a bit hard, and the hardened cheese on top reminds me of a newbie mistake, as if you are baking at home for the first time. It was ok, but I did not finish. Thankfully I had others to help me LOL!  I would not object to returning again if in the downtown area. It was nice to escape a bit from the hotel. There's also plenty of misters outside if you want to be on the patio area when it's hot outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Macaroni and cheese

Am1FlkMaSHK7-sYM0ZmZfA.text: We stopped for a couple drinks and enjoyed the atmosphere. The bar service was very good. Recommended relaxing spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pregame relaxation with Jack Daniels.

3A3yd4JKhcuWMuAyeekF3g.text: Seamus Happy Hour!  The corned beef nachos were awesome! Try the fish, Mac & cheese (aka cheese and macaroni) or the shepherds pie.....all in a pub atmosphere. You can't go wrong!

kih4iFzk7ygjPPC3cTVhsQ.text: This is a cool Irish pub, one of my favorite Irish pubs, it's simple and dark and cool. Fun to come for a drink. My husband says it's one of the best bloody Mary's depending on bartender. Has some TVs so you can catch a game and has good fish and chips. Very quiet and relaxing bar sometimes it can get rowdy but very nice.

6zHdknxHcSrWQwaK8_aF4A.text: It was nice inside. It's a bar. Service was pleasant. I liked my Corn beef and cabbage. It was a large dish. I liked it. It was a tad fatty though. It was very flavorful. The carrots and cabbage really had flavor. The soda bread was not warm, but it was good. They have good ice cubes. I love ice so I notice that kind of thing. I would like to try more of their menu items.

U80SzftycHLcI8tiKNqadg.text: Came here because it was the closest bar to our hotel. It was really a nice place. Got the potato nachos and a few pints of beer. Some other people at our table got Mac and cheese. They said it was great. Service was excellent as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BC9oY46ly1uCwmRy9XwFhA.text: I enjoyed the Garlic Parmesan Burger for lunch. I was extremely thankful to find somewhere that takes pride in flavor. So many times we order burgers and are presented an unseasoned piece of meat. NOT HERE!! Enjoyed every bit and had amazing service as well to go with it.

3YFFnAknTYspq-UBY2BltA.text: Walking into this bar is like being at a pub in Ireland. It has the atmosphere of many pubs I have visited in the Emerald Isle, and I have visited many. The only thing missing was a fireplace, which I didn't see one. But, this isn't important since the bar is in Arizona. All other aspects of the bar seemed authentic, well, maybe down with an Irish accent would help. The food was typical Irish and fare and very good. Many of the typical Irish food favorites were in the menu. The drinks were well prepared and strong. This is a nice.l place to stop in if you want to be transported back to the island or if you haven't been there, a chance to experience the flavor of Ireland.  The location is easily reached by the Metro train.

photos.caption: Photo of Seamus McCaffrey's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-9ecD_cIJ0syXWX1KhNvZw.text: Probably the best Rueben I have ever had. I would have taken a picture but I couldn't stop eating it. Awesome chips. Meal was super hot and quick. And  the staff was super friendly and attentive.

7ZyLHv4tLd6me3nmUhHilQ.text: The food was awesome! Went here on a date with my boyfriend and I enjoyed the atmosphere-- The buzz of people filling the place, coupled with the food and good drink selection made my night. Would definitely come back!

0RRwhrVLxtVGYDRdf_zYUg.text: The beer is cold the staff attentive & the Paddy Melt good. The hubs was disappointed by the Fish & Chips. I have to say he ordered a traditionally English pub food at an Irish pub so you get what you get. He did eat the other half of my Paddy Melt which tells you how not good his fish was. He's that guy always looking for the best Fish & Chips & Fish Tacos. He'll try either of those anywhere. What can I say he's cute & if nothing else consistent. I can't wait to get back to try some of the other menu items (excluding the fish & chips).

tK3HXtuwg8ztWN0fZo_fbw.text: I was introduced to this place a year ago I did really enjoy go here. In the last month they have changed menu prices have gone up while quality has gone down. The service is horrible with a very rude server Brooke and an even worse manager do not expect her to care. If you have limited time I would not suggest going here as it takes forever to get anything. Also the place is really dirty now and would be considered a dive can't even imagine what the kitchen looks like. Skip this place many other better places to go downtown.

Ibfxwc4xXn_rJMA5F6lf5g.text: Horrible service.  I've been going to this pub for years since I work across the street.  This last month I noticed the service went downhill.  Today, my friends and I went there for lunch trying to wine down.  We got our food after 40 minutes of waiting.  When we said something, (Brook the waitress) answered in a very rude manner stating she was overwhelmed and we weren't the only ones waiting.  We asked to speak to the manager, and she was just as bad as her.  I will not be going back to that place!

nvrlkYf52axOHXnq4IDEGQ.text: Cool place. Totally dig the neighborhood pub vibe.  Unfortunately, the service is absolutely awful. The bartenders and waitresses are pretty rude and generally pretend like they didn't hear you when you've asked them three times for the same thing

HVDrGx8BM1n8MyVBFFaxww.text: This is such a great place to just stop by alone and get a beer or sit with your family and have a wonderful dinner or after work with good friends. Wonderful salads, great staff, and the best iced tea in Phoenix. Did we mention they're open when everything else in downtown is closed?? :]

TBJMlSGLAerdfx-_r0P6tA.text: Very friendly bar with the best fried fish I've ever had.  You'll feel welcomed into this fun bar and the service is top notch.  Great selection of whiskey !  It's convenient to downtown and the perfect place to stop in and have a beer and bite to eat.

PGKkwNOOyQZdkLHfpFocow.text: Hey just FYI, try the potato skins, nasty made with imitation bacobits! Frozen potato skins as well. Other food was predictable.good price.

8J-S5iYgNXFoGL5Zh31spw.text: Good food in the heart of Downtown if you are in the area I suggest you stop by for a pint and some fish'n'chips.

uiiswvNOPkc5ztVPTFtOBg.text: How is it that I, a meat and potato lover, am just now finding this"boxty"? It was amazing! I had the Steak & Guinness Stout Boxty and it was incredible. Nice pieces of tender steak, mushrooms, rich gravy, and a crispy shredded potato cake on top. Amazing. My wife had the beef stew and she said it was very good - nice sized serving and she couldn't eat it all. Nice authentic feeling Irish pub feel. I recommend this place.

1udG-WjLa61DxEKHAUUxqg.text: Perched at the bottom of the classy Hotel San Carlos, this cozy little pub was quite inviting yesterday after a long day of walking and gawking at ComicCon.  Ginger beer + Jameson totally hit the spot - followed by their French dip which was superb.  For me, with a French dip, it's all about the bread and the au jus.  I assume you've got the roast beef figured out, and they did.  The bread was nice and fresh, and the au jus was spot on.  Far too many places don't stir their au jus before putting it in the cup, which leads to basically dunking your sandwich in bland broth... but theirs was great.  The ambiance is classy and the service was good, I look forward to a mini staycation at the hotel and will definitely be back.

y4URc7Q0WKo98DG9nHdFGA.text: Somewhat of a dive but perfect for late nights after hitting downtown.   Careful for the death trap to and from the bathroom, those stairs have taken down many a drunk.

bb9B547OOPbG-H9wRwSM6w.text: Great little bar down town.   They get oddly crazy busy just about every night of the week. I love living down town!   Their kitchen stays open late, midnight I think, they have great beers and cocktails, its a scotch drinkers dream, I couldn't even count then number of single malts they had up there behind the bar. I dragged the boyfriend in a few months ago and he is in heaven!  I love the down town feel for this whole in the wall-ish bar that has been around forever it seems.   Might be fun to have a few drinks then wonder over to the San Carlos hotel and get spooked. haha :-)

COlP4KyWkoOfzTu7O-G1jg.text: Been here dozen times have not been disappointed yet.  The scotch menu is vast and I've always been served with a smile.  Anything fried is above average and the black-and-tan is always poured to perfection

5HKZaQ6ZKBbwRHaDJy9Hkg.text: A favorite pub of mine. Cheap and strong drinks. Friendly staff and always a good crowd.

w-sYAQGKR8RcMyUReNRB3w.text: Came here on a Friday night after a bike ride. As an Irish bar, there is a lot of whiskey on the wall, but they can make whatever you need. The food was a hell of a lot better than I thought it was going to be.  On the encouragement of the bouncer, I ordered the wings which were meaty but I've had better. What I should have gotten was the shepards pie. 2 of my friends got it, and it was VERY good. I'm going to go back, just get it on my own.  Lastly, this place dishes out cheap, strong drinks. Good place to get sauced before hitting a club.

4FAi8kXtKh_TZasQEUfpTQ.text: It's a bar! It's eclectic ...parking sucks...if it's crowded in the front u gotta walk thru smoke. The restroom situation isn't the best...but.. it's a bar. I go every once in a while. Check it out.

bVz_NIcjTwp2moULkR-saA.text: First off didn't stay here very long may be an hour or so, but seems legit. Cute college girls and full bar a plus, but a little run down. Appetizers (wings) were not very good. Drinks were on the soft side. Like the live band, and willing to give place another chance in the future

iyBf4GpQu56UBGIPMOS-gA.text: BEST SHEPHERD'S PIE I'VE EVER HAD!  Service was slow because there was just one waiter to serve the full house. He was so nice, I felt bad for him! We will definitely be returning, great environment, they don't skimp on the alcohol, and I now have a constant aching for the shepherd's pie!

oRTVi_h7hYiQptRzK3mTPg.text: The restaurant itself and overall vibe doesn't deserve the 1 star, it really seems like it's a great place. Unfortunately our server made the night a terrible experience to end off at from the very beginning. You could tell she had a challenging night but she took it out on her new customers and was nicer to another table that she didn't even realize was with our same group. It was a frustrating evening that we had to shrug off. Not how I pictured the night ending so can't say I'll be back there anytime soon.

vGDaoO1UhCAd-qtPdyLR4Q.text: Stopped in for what would thought would be some great fish and Chips. After enjoying the George Strait concert the night before and still on a high having such a great weekend we were sadly disappointed. Talk about Grease The fries were not bad ate part of the first piece of fish and as the other sat the grease started pooling on the plate. When asked by the waitress how everything and stating a bit greasy to her  her reply was well its fried food...Very poor customer service ..one place we will never enter again..

PVJOo2295NcovQQTE_lpQQ.text: visiting from San Diego and thought we should stop in. Food was great and authentic irish (is that an oxymoron). The waitress did fudge up the order of beers but I like all beers so the problem wasn't really a problem after-all. It's location right around the ball park made it super convenient. We will definitely be back for a weekend night sometime in the near future.

EGgybu36L0hT8UMn3zOibg.text: upon entry it is immediately evident this is a 'pee anywhere' establishment, complete w/ pee pee scented pint glasses. stay away from the black & yellow.

ORpWIGpKNOi6cZJc0AzwSw.text: Awesome pub, went there before the Dbacks game, good food and drink for good prices. Recommend this over most the bars around there.

vV0pwZErNTsZe4SntsQSqQ.text: Four stars because I have never left disappointed. Sure there are things the management could do better, it could be nicer inside, the appetizers could be a tad more appealing, and the wait staff could be a bit better at remembering things, but that's not why you come here.  The location is perfect, it's close to most everything downtown - the drinks are cheap to reasonably priced (you won't get nickle and dimed here), and the bartenders are great to talk to. They have a great selection of whiskey and scotch, and must better prices than other downtown bars (I'm looking at you Hanny's)!

i4rDqDBHPSMgXQKUouJVRg.text: Pretty cool place, easy to get to downtown, food is pretty good, irish atmosphere... i like it... not a lengthy review but it is a good place

BahpEbpy_9jvRIAgmMJnuA.text: Shepherd's pie washed down with an icy pint of Newcastle... mmm! There was a gooey chewy layer of cheese over the potatoes and I could really taste the peas and flavoring with the meat. A side order of Irish soda bread came with it. I wasn't too into this (it was crumbly like cornbread but more dense and the flavor was practically non-existent, but maybe that's what soda bread is, I don't know) so I swapped that for some garlic bread which was actually a breadstick with some butter swiped onto one side... didn't work out for me. Like the other reviewers said and I agree, the bathroom (I only saw one M/F share) is questionable. And although the location of the pub is very close to the light rail, I still have to go all the way downtown to get there and I'm incredibly lazy, so I won't be making any special trips.  There are a lot of items on the menu besides the usual Irish things, such as burgers, salads, and sandwiches. Pricing is inexpensive.

6ppaZAWCrxMznO-uiJ5TgA.text: I definitely don't make special trips downtown to have a pint here anymore, but if I happen to be in the area for a night, then I will generally stop in. It's not the nicest "pub" in town, but it's cozy. The food isn't fabulous, but the wings are pretty good and as far as bar grub goes, it actually isn't bad. The staff is usually quite nice and if you happen in more than once, they seem to remember you, which is a huge plus in my book. But the best part of any visit is the people watching. There is literally a cross-section of the entire Phoenix area crammed in to this one little spot. And I love that there is absolutely not one pretentious bone in the whole place. I spent one night there on my hands and knees helping my friend find his tooth (literally it popped out like 5 times) and no one even gave us a second glance! I guess that alone should rate this place a solid 3.5 stars!!!

2QZuzCORfRYTQxv0JquS9w.text: just say no.  this place is truly awful.  too bad it's taking up valuable space on monroe.

im8m9iS1EblIPbUr11rrvw.text: Decent Irish pub in downtown Phoenix...nothing exceptional about it, but good place to have a beer with friends!

4QH3Kx-r7Tb7jCoukq-ZyA.text: this is a decent bar in downtown phoenix, but not really special in any way.   it's too expensive, not irish at all (most of the music is, like, tupac and deftones and stuff), and overall just kind of boring.  the food is pretty good, for sure. also, there is supposedly a ghost lady haunting the place (when you go upstairs to the bathroom you get a creeeeeEEEEEeeeeeeeeepy feeling), and sometimes you get to see some sweet fights. and once some huge creepy dude was either hitting one me or possibly going to kill me, i couldn't tell.   good location, right next to san carlos, but there are better bars.

8rhbviN5ECyYyOdfIgFEAw.text: Had a great happy hour there. Staff are very nice and helpful. This place attracts good people. Shepard's pie is delicious, so is their fish and chips.

hjqnJFKLTCuJ-Y9KnvEe7A.text: Absolutely love this place.  Frank, the owner, bought the place from Seamus, who went on to start Rosie McCaffrey's.  You won't find a more authentic Irish pub in Arizona.  Plenty of choices for beer on tap, although no domestic beer on tap.  If you go, get the fish & chips or the shepherd's pie.  If Andy is tending bar, you'll be well taken care of.  Check out Andy's authentic collection of police patches around the bar area.

b68R7kYcKKuMP5fPdJ3NeA.text: This is exactly what an Irish pub should be; the bar is unassuming and not trendy or too upscale. It's a nice "neighborhood-type" spot, with live music, great food and bartenders who pour drinks a little heavy-handed.

9lnP8bPtQcpOYgrwlvPs4w.text: Great location, good beer and liquor selections, prices on the higher side, mixed service, lame food.  I've met up with friends downtown at this location several times.  The Irish in me is drawn to these watering holes faster than an Arizona Republican is drawn to a pro-S.B.1070 rally.  I want to like this place more than I do...  Maybe it's the higher prices and lack of any sort of happy hour that provides good deals.  Maybe it's the fact that the rubin I ordered looked like one of those sandwiches mom packed in my lunch box stuffed in a ziplock bag back in 3rd grade - and didn't seem to taste much better...  Or maybe it's just the fact that with all of the other great places there are to eat and drink downtown, Seamus didn't get the memo.  Bottom line, stop in for a beer if you're in the area but look elsewhere for deals and good food.

AJ0f6wV35I1rcfEILDmlhw.text: Five stars for the amazing two person band that played there last Saturday!  They rocked Last Dance with Mary Jane and we had an amazing waitress who brought on the shots and beers!

hunmAlVvv1Bbfi_EdYdG6A.text: Seamus is a dive hole in the wall. I have been drinking there for almost a decade. Everything is overpoured, and you can fall off a barstool here and nobody will care. I've seen fights break out, been in fights, lost wallets on the walk home, etc. That said... it's my kind of place, just crappy enough to be awesome. I don't recommend the food, but if you want to go out with friends and really tie one off this is the place!

iZ3qZJgOS-Hnx2dopiEYsg.text: Not bad at all.  I come here about 3-4 times a month during lunch.  Whenever I do go there my friends and I usually sit at the bar because you get a lil better service from the bar tender when you are eating lunch or having drinks.  I don't know how the service will be at the bar from now on since the bar tender has resigned as of St. Patricks day.  Will just have to go down and check it out.  Recommendations: try the Sheppards Pie or Fish and Chips.  Also on the way in check out the special of the day which is written on a chalk board outside the front door. 6d4KTlaaLrNWQkDuta8fsw.text: I take the light-rail downtown sometimes just to go here. I walked in the first time to a bustling, energetic, singing, cheering crowd and thought, "where the H am I??" I felt like I had left Phoenix and ended up in a far away magical land of wonder and excitement. Food is decent for a bar, great beer, great local music (it's the first time I saw The Waters). Downtown Phoenix needs more places like this.

jsfEYRYPA_Lm2HTuHWIgzg.text: Run of the mill Irish bar, but with a friendly bartender and cheap shots. Most of the customers seemed pretty drunk. There are not many nighttime options in downtown Phoenix so this had to do.

And pours of the Middleton are dirt cheap here, sub-20 bucks. Amazing.  Recommended for lunch or happy hour if you're downtown and looking for that olde style Irish pub.

8zcZk6IA916XVJSkIzN_Pg.text: Fun lively bar in the valley of the sun.  Happy people, drinks and music.  Classic Irish drunkenness all about.

1k89vmbvijHHEGeFa0I0cg.text: I am so glad that I waited to write this review.  When I first visited Seamus I awed by the cozy at home feel that this place gave you. The drinks were typical for a bar and occasionally there was live music. I thought it was a fun place to visit. The decor is typical fun for an Irish pub, love the troll and leprechaun dolls in the showcase.  Now that I visit here more often I am in love with this bar.  Brandon is an amazing bartender.  I love going here in Sunday's to enjoy the most amazingly delicious chicken pot pie in town while enjoying the best playlist provided by Randal.   Go for the drinks, go for the food, and go for the fun. Definitely just go to Seamus.

A6XZGGVx9AR4fya-VRVO8Q.text: The food and beer were excellent, however the service left a little to be desired. i went in with my girlfriend and she wanted to know which one of the burgers on the menu was the spiciest.The waiter just simply responded with "I dont know" and just left it at that. it wasnt that huge of a deal but it irked me.

j2Y5AcUYg8iy0H0kUOksYQ.text: I looked for boxty all over Ireland. I read about it and I found out in Ireland that is not such a common thing. It's a traditional plate in Ulster but it's hard to find. The pub advertises it as something from Galway or the West of Ireland. Be aware that it's completely inaccurate since you can only potentially find it in the 9 counties (Ulster). I stopped at this pub on the 19th of September and it was for lunch time. The pub looks very much like any pub in Ireland that I visited in Ireland. I has a relaxed atmosphere and people sitting at the counter enjoying beers. While there I saw a man and a woman have a friendly conversation. I really wanted to try the boxty so I chose the corned beef and cabbage boxty. I also ordered an Angry Orchard cider which was the only cider on tap (I really wanted an Irish cider on tap). The food arrived in 10-15 minutes. The boxty was presenting well and it was placed on top of a generous dish of corned beef and cabbage. The boxty, a potato pancake, was tasty. It was finely mashed and the outside tasted somewhat buttery. I like the potato part but not so much the butter flavor (I'm not a fan of large quantities of butter, especially with potatoes). The corned beef was decent but there was plenty of fat. The cabbage was not amazing because it was plain. All in all I like the boxty was good but what came with it was not so exciting. The cider was great an refreshing. Angry Orchard is not Irish but it's darn good and it's definitely one of my favorite ciders. It very much compares to the ciders I had in Ireland and Northern Ireland. I give this pub 4 stars, primarily for the atmosphere, the music and the boxty. In this pub they play great music because I heard all the great stuff from the late 60s and early 70s (classics from Simon & Garfunkel, The Beatles, CSN/CSNY, The Byrds, CCR, Bob Dylan and much more). The menu needs some corrections: boxty is from Ulster and not Galway, one dollar sign is missing under the boxty section. I believe this is a good place to relax and meet other folks. All in all, I am a fan and I liked Seamus McCaffrey's (to be accurate, the name of the pub should be fixed to Seamus which is the proper spelling).

xJTGY3gewGWVltl66aqRrQ.text: Ugh...  The hype and size of this place is why it is getting 2 stars.  Both times I have been here (on a Saturday night) there has been NOWHERE to sit and it has taken 5+ minutes for a beer. If I want a pub feel, I will go to George & Dragon.  At the George & Dragon, it is out of the Central Phoenix melee, has ample parking, seating for days, and takes at most a minute for a drink.   If I am going to a McCaffrey establishment, I would MUCH rather go to Rosie's which is bigger and a few miles away.  I seem to have come here a bunch recently for bar-crawls and I will be avoiding this place like the plague.  I'll go to Hannie's or Cityscape instead, thanks.

If you want a place that doesn't seem so fancy and you just want to have a bar among regulars then this is your spot.   Recommend to everyone.
